title: newAssistant(e) logistique transport maritime
description:
Effectuer la fonction de service à la clientèle quotidienne selon les besoins du client.

Ce poste implique de fortes responsabilités en matière de service à la clientèle

Principales responsabilités

  • Surveiller et coordonner les expéditions, y compris la communication avec les bureaux à l'étranger, le ramassage, la livraison des marchandises ; suivi du fret, documentation, assurance et comptabilité.
  • Conseiller les clients sur les procédures d'importation de fret maritime, les réglementations internationales (ex: procédures de paiement).
  • Obtenir et produire toutes les informations pertinentes (outre-mer, documents bancaires, consulats, agences gouvernementales, etc.).
  • Organiser le transport et la documentation avec les transporteurs.
  • Produire des informations et une documentation précises dans les délais précisés.
  • Développer les relations d'affaires et faire le suivi avec les clients et partenaires (ex : transporteurs).
  • Assister les membres des agents intermédiaires et juniors dans la résolution de problèmes.
  • S'assurer que l'entreprise ferme tous les dossiers dans le délai établi.
  • Participer à l'amélioration de la qualité et des processus.

Autres exigences du poste

  • Nombre de transactions et profit par transaction,
  • saisie de données et traitement de l'information précis et en temps opportun,
  • établissement des coûts et facturation précis et en temps opportun pour la clôture des dossiers, et pleine conformité de tous les processus et exigences du service pour améliorer la satisfaction des clients.

Formation et expérience de travail

  • Diplôme d'études collégiales en logistique et transport
  • Plus de 5 ans d'expérience dans le domaine du transport
  • Bilingue (français/anglais)

Autres

  • Lieu de travail : 1221, 32e avenue, Lachine, Québec
  • Horaire de travail : du lundi au vendredi de 9h30 à 18h

UPS Supply Chain Solutions offre une rémunération globale compétitive comprenant :

  • Régime d'épargne-retraite
  • Plan d'achat d'actions d’UPS
  • Remboursement de vos frais de scolarité
  • Programme d'aide aux employés pour vous et votre famille
  • 5 + 2 jours discrétionnaires par an + vacances annuelles
  • Variété de rabais chez certains fournisseurs pour nos employés vous êtes éligible dès votre embauche.
  • Opportunités de développement et de progression de carrière dans plusieurs unités commerciales et zones géographiques d’UPS SCS.

Couverture d'avantages sociaux concurrentiels et même certaines primes payées entièrement par l’employeur qui comprend :

  • Une assurance vie pour vous et votre famille
  • Variété de spécialistes : Ostéopathe, Naturopathe, Masseur, Acupuncteur, Orthophoniste, Diététicien, Chiropraticien, Kinésithérapeute, Podiatre, Psychologue, Travailleur social, etc.
  • Assistance voyage d'urgence pour vous et votre famille
  • Services et fournitures médicaux tels qu'ambulance, appareils auditifs, chaussures orthopédiques, etc.
  • Soins de la vue, y compris examen des yeux, lunettes ou lentilles de contact
  • Services dentaires, y compris orthodontie
  • Programme d'invalidité de courte et de longue durée

Type d'emploi : Temps plein, Permanent

Salaire : à partir de 22,07$ par heure

Avantages :

  • Assurance Dentaire
  • Assurance Invalidité
  • Assurance Maladie Complémentaire
  • Assurance Vie
  • Assurance Vision
  • Bourses d'Études
  • Congés de Vacances et Compensatoires
  • Options d'Achats d'Actions
  • Programme d'Aide aux Employés
  • Réductions Tarifaires
  • Régime d'Achat d'Actions
  • Régime de retraite
  • Stationnement sur place
  • Tenue Décontractée

Horaire :

  • 8 Heures
  • Du Lundi au Vendredi
  • Quart de jour

Expérience:

  • transport maritime: 3 ans (Obligatoire)
skills: ["Type d'emploi : Temps plein, Permanent", 'Ce poste implique de fortes responsabilités en matière de service à la clientèle', 'Salaire\xa0: à partir de 22,07$ par heure', "Bourses d'Études"]

title: Customs Brokerage Representative I
description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

Working from home

Initial training will be held in the office Nelson Road, Vancouver.

Work Schedule: Wednesday to Sunday 11pm to 6am, overnight shift.

Position Summary:

  • To process customs clearance (release) AND/OR confirm declarations for repetitive and non-complex shipments guided by the CCBS system and personal skills.Client (Internal/External):Import operations, Support Services, Consulting, Inbound services, Sales, etc, and all customs clients and partnersSpecific output or services:
  • Customs release AND/OR confirm declarations for repetitive and non-complex shipments using client' profile in CCBS system (creates or modifies line code/classification)
  • Handle delivery service AND/OR import permits requests if required AND/OR gather and send proper documentation to the government


Job Key Contributions/Task:

  • Data entry (open customers' files, validate information, credit and invoicing)
  • Collect supplementary information or documentation from customers, drivers, custom and other offices, etc, when required
  • Identify customer profiles discrepancies
  • Answer standard questions and requests from customers, drivers, customs and other offices
  • Work as team member with other actors: clients, UPS SCS employees, carriers, inbound agents


Qualifications required

  • 6 months to 2 years of experience
  • High school degree
  • Bilingualism required - intermediate level (in Quebec Only)
  • Basic knowledge in Customs operations, laws and regulations, and other government departments
  • Basic understanding of HS system
  • Basic computer skills

UPS Supply Chain Solutions offers a competitive total compensation package including:

  • Retirement savings plan
  • UPS Stock Purchase Plan
  • Reimbursement of your tuition fees
  • Employee Assistance Program for you and your family
  • 5 discretionary days per year + Annual vacation
  • Variety of discounts at certain suppliers for our employees, you are eligible as soon as you are hired.
  • Development and career progression opportunities across multiple UPS SCS business units and geographies.

Competitive benefits coverage and even some premiums paid entirely by the employer which includes:

  • Variety of specialists: Osteopath, Naturopath, Masseur, Acupuncturist, Speech therapist, Dietitian, Chiropractor, Physiotherapist, Podiatrist, Psychologist, Social worker, etc.
  • Emergency travel assistance for you and your family
  • Medical services and supplies such as ambulance, hearing aids, orthopedic shoes, etc.
  • Vision care, including eye exam, glasses or contact lenses
  • Life insurance for you and your family
  • Dental services including orthodontics
  • Short and long term disability program

UPS Canada is a diverse and equal opportunity employer. Please advise our HR representatives if workplace accommodation is needed. Thank you for your interest in UPS Canada.

Job Description:

Join our team today!

This position is full time 40 hours per week Monday to Friday 8.30AM to 5PM.

After 90 days the UPS benefits is accessible for new employees.

Work Location: 1221, 32nd avenue, Lachine, Quebec.

Responsibilities:

  • Tasks related to the mailroom; using Canada Post, UPS system, enter datas, sort mail.
  • Assist in clerical tasks: information gathering, documentation, photocopying, faxing, splitting, etc
  • Performs data entry/scanning.
  • Completes first screen of B3 (customers’ files), open LVS, etc.
  • Assists raters in general office duties: reports, forms, claims, etc.
  • Answers phone calls from partners and other offices.
  • Operates scanning station for imaging.


Qualifications:

  • Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint
  • Strong typing skills
  • Ability to read spreadsheets, extract information in Excel format, and communicate findings to management team
  • Excellent communication skills (French & English)
  • Ability to prioritize daily tasks and promote a positive work environment

UPS Supply Chain Solutions offers a competitive compensation package including:

  • Defined Contribution Pension Plan
  • Retirement Saving Plan
  • Stock Purchase Plan
  • Education Assistance Program
  • Employee Assistance Program for you and your family
  • 5+2 discretionary days per year + annual vacation days
  • Variety of store discounts for our Upsers.
  • Career development and progression opportunities across multiple business units and geographies

  • Competitive Benefits coverage and premium paid partially by the employer which include:
  • Life Insurance for you and your family
  • Variety of specialists : Osteopath, Naturopath, Masseur, Acupuncturist, Speech Therapist, Dietician, Chiropractor, Physiotherapist, Podiatrist, Psychologist, Social Worker, etc.
  • Emergency Travel Assistance for you and your family
  • Medical services and supplies such as ambulance, hearing aids, orthopedic shoes, etc.
  • Vision care including eyes exam, glasses or contacts
  • Dental Services including orthodontics services
  • Short Term and Long Term Disability benefits

title: Assistant(e) administratif (ve)
description:
Avant de postuler pour un emploi, sélectionnez votre préférence linguistique parmi les options
disponibles en haut à droite de cette page.

Explorez vos futures possibilités de carrière au sein d’une organisation figurant sur la liste mondiale des 500 plus grandes entreprises du magazine Fortune. Imaginez les possibilités novatrices, découvrez notre culture enrichissante et travaillez avec des équipes qui vous aideront à atteindre votre plein potentiel. Nous savons que, pour assurer l’avenir d’UPS, nous avons besoin de candidats possédant une combinaison unique d’aptitudes et de passion. Vous possédez les qualités nécessaires pour gérer vos activités et celles des membres d’une équipe? Nous avons des postes qui vous permettront de consolider vos acquis et de faire avancer votre carrière au prochain niveau.

Description du poste

UPS Supply Chain Solutions recrute pour plusieurs postes!

Rejoignez notre équipe dès aujourd'hui !

Ce poste est à temps plein 40 heures par semaine du lundi au vendredi de 8h à 16h30 ou de 8h30 à 17h.

Les avantages sociaux d’UPS SCS sont accessibles aux nouveaux employés après 90 jours!

Lieu de travail : 1221, 32e avenue, Lachine, Québec

Responsabilités:

  • Aider aux tâches de bureau : collecte d'informations, documentation, photocopie, télécopie, tri de documents, etc.
  • Effectue la saisie/l'analyse des données à l’ordinateur.
  • Répond aux appels téléphoniques des collègues de travail ou de clients à l’occasion.

Qualifications:

  • Compétences intermédiaires Microsoft Excel, Word et Outlook
  • Excellente vitesse de frappe (Min de 25 mots/minute)
  • Capacité à lire des feuilles de calcul, appliquer des filtres, trier les données et extraire des informations en format Excel.
  • Bilingue niveau intermédiaire dans les deux langues français et anglais

UPS Supply Chain Solutions propose un portefolio d’avantages compétitif comprenant :

  • Régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées
  • Plan d'épargne-retraite (REER)
  • Régime d'achat d'actions
  • Programme de remboursement des frais de scolarité pour compléter vos études universitaires.
  • Programme d'aide aux employés pour vous et votre famille
  • 5+2 jours discrétionnaires par année + jours de vacances annuelles
  • Variété de rabais chez certains fournisseurs pour nos Upsers
  • Opportunités de développement de carrière et de progression dans plusieurs unités commerciales et zones géographiques

Avantages sociaux concurrentiels et certaines primes payées entièrement par l'employeur ceux-ci comprennent :

  • Assurance vie pour vous et votre famille
  • Variété de spécialistes : Ostéopathe, Naturopathe, Masseur, Acupuncteur, Orthophoniste, Diététiste, Chiropraticien, Physiothérapeute, Podiatre, Psychologue, Travailleur social, etc.
  • Assistance voyage d'urgence pour vous et votre famille
  • Services et fournitures médicales tels qu'ambulance, prothèses auditives, chaussures orthopédiques, etc.
  • Soins de la vue, y compris examen des yeux, lunettes ou lentilles de contact
  • Services dentaires, y compris les services d'orthodontie
  • Prestations d'invalidité de courte et de longue durée

UPS Canada est un employeur inclusif et qui adhère au principe d’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Veuillez aviser un représentant des ressources humaines si une mesure d’adaptation du lieu de travail est requise. Merci de l’intérêt que vous portez à UPS Canada.

title: District Account Executive
description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

Join the UPS Team today!

Monday to Friday: Day Shift

Working from home + Great portfolio of benefits for our employees.

This position develops and manages a portfolio of assigned clients (Business-to-Business) within a specific geographical area.

Responsibilities:

  • Searches and develops potential clients to meet monthly sales targets.

  • Makes contact by telephone or email to get initial customer information and sets up an appointment.

  • Analyzes customer needs, prepares bids, and presents UPS services.

  • Focuses on retaining and penetrating active clients in portfolio.

  • Completes maintenance, problem resolution, and sales management of client portfolio.

  • Monitors sales through the drafting and updating of reports and internal systems.


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's Degree or International equivalent

  • Meets local age and operations requirements to operate a vehicle

  • Willing to travel

  • Working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, and Outlook

  • Availability to work flexible hours

  • Bilingual (French and English)

UPS Supply Chain Solutions offers a competitive compensation package including:

  • Defined Contribution Pension Plan, Retirement Saving Plan

  • Stock Purchase Plan

  • Education Assistance Program

  • Employee Assistance Program for you and your family

  • 5 discretionary days per year + vacation + floater days available

  • Variety of store discounts for our Upsers.

  • Career development and progression opportunities across multiple business units and geographies

  • Competitive Benefits coverage and premium paid by the employer which including:

  • Life Insurance for you and your family

  • Variety of specialists : Osteopath, Naturopath, Masseur, Acupuncturist, Speech Therapist, Dietician, Chiropractor, Physiotherapist, Podiatrist, Psychologist, Social Worker, etc.

  • Emergency Travel Assistance

  • Medical services and supplies such as ambulance, hearing aids, private nurse, orthopedic shoes, etc.

  • Vision care including eyes exam, glasses or contacts

  • Dental including orthodontics services

  • Short Term and Long Term Disability benefits

UPS Canada is a diverse and equal opportunity employer. Please advise our HR representatives if workplace accommodation is needed. Thank you for your interest in UPS Canada.

Job Description:

Position Summary

Perform daily customer service function as per client's needs. This position involves strong Customer Service responsibilities

Key Accountabilities

  • Monitor and coordination of shipments including communication with overseas offices, pick up, delivery of goods; freight monitoring, documentation, insurance and accounting.
  • Advise customers regarding sea freight import procedures, international regulations (ex: payments procedures).
  • Obtain and produce all pertinent information (overseas, bank related documents, consulates, government agencies, etc.).
  • Organize transport and documentation with carriers.
  • Produce accurate information and documentation on time.
  • Develop business relations and follow up with customers and partners (ex: carriers).
  • Assist Intermediate and Junior agents’ members in problem solving.
  • Ensure the Company closes all files within the set time frame establish.
  • Participate in improving quality and processes.

Other Job requirements

  • Number of transactions and profit per transaction, accurate and timely data entry and information processing, accurate and timely costing and billing for closing of files, and full compliance of all department processes and requirements to improve clients’ satisfaction.

Education and Work Experience

  • College degree in Logistics and transportation
  • More than 5 years of experience in the transportation field
  • Bilingual (French/English)

Job location: 1221, 32e avenue, Lachine, Quebec

Work Schedule: Monday to Friday 9.30AM to 6PM

UPS Supply Chain Solutions offers a competitive total compensation package including:

  • Retirement savings plan
  • UPS Stock Purchase Plan
  • Reimbursement of your tuition fees
  • Employee Assistance Program for you and your family
  • 5 + 2 discretionary days per year + annual vacation
  • Variety of discounts at certain suppliers for our employees, you are eligible as soon as you are hired.
  • Development and career progression opportunities across multiple UPS SCS business units and geographies.

Competitive benefits coverage and even some premiums paid entirely by the employer which includes:

  • Variety of specialists: Osteopath, Naturopath, Masseur, Acupuncturist, Speech therapist, Dietitian, Chiropractor, Physiotherapist, Podiatrist, Psychologist, Social worker, etc.
  • Emergency travel assistance for you and your family
  • Medical services and supplies such as ambulance, hearing aids, orthopedic shoes, etc.
  • Vision care, including eye exam, glasses or contact lenses
  • Life insurance for you and your family
  • Dental services including orthodontics
  • Short and long term disability program

UPS Canada is a diverse and equal opportunity employer. Please advise our HR representatives if workplace accommodation is needed. Thank you for your interest in UPS Canada.

title: Commis à la messagerie
description:
Avant de postuler pour un emploi, sélectionnez votre préférence linguistique parmi les options
disponibles en haut à droite de cette page.

Explorez vos futures possibilités de carrière au sein d’une organisation figurant sur la liste mondiale des 500 plus grandes entreprises du magazine Fortune. Imaginez les possibilités novatrices, découvrez notre culture enrichissante et travaillez avec des équipes qui vous aideront à atteindre votre plein potentiel. Nous savons que, pour assurer l’avenir d’UPS, nous avons besoin de candidats possédant une combinaison unique d’aptitudes et de passion. Vous possédez les qualités nécessaires pour gérer vos activités et celles des membres d’une équipe? Nous avons des postes qui vous permettront de consolider vos acquis et de faire avancer votre carrière au prochain niveau.

Description du poste

Joignez-vous à notre équipe dès aujourd'hui!
Ce poste est à temps plein 40 heures par semaine du lundi au vendredi de 8h30 à 17h00.
Après 90 jours, les avantages UPS sont accessibles aux nouveaux employés.
Lieu de travail : 1221, 32e avenue, Lachine, Québec.
Responsabilités:
  • Tâches reliées à la salle du courrier; à l'aide de Postes Canada, du système UPS, entrer des données, trier le courrier.
  • Aider aux tâches administratives : collecte d'informations, documentation, photocopie, télécopie, fractionnement, etc.
  • Effectue la saisie/numérisation des données.
  • Complète le premier écran de B3 (fichiers clients), ouvre LVS, etc.
  • Assiste les évaluateurs dans les tâches générales de bureau : rapports, formulaires, réclamations, etc.
  • Répond aux appels téléphoniques des partenaires et des autres bureaux.
  • Exploite la station de numérisation pour l'imagerie.
Qualifications:
  • Microsoft Excel, Word et PowerPoint
  • Solides compétences en dactylographie
  • Capacité à lire des feuilles de calcul, à extraire des informations au format Excel et à communiquer les résultats à l'équipe de direction
  • Excellentes compétences en communication (français et anglais)
  • Capacité à prioriser les tâches quotidiennes et à promouvoir un environnement de travail positif
UPS Supply Chain Solutions propose un package de rémunération compétitif comprenant :
  • Régime de retraite à cotisations déterminées
  • Plan d'Épargne Retraite
  • Régime d'achat d'actions
  • Programme d'aide à l'éducation
  • Programme d'aide aux employés pour vous et votre famille
  • 5+2 jours discrétionnaires par an + jours de vacances annuelles
  • Variété de remises en magasin pour nos Upsers.
  • Opportunités de développement de carrière et de progression dans plusieurs unités commerciales et zones géographiques
La couverture des avantages concurrentiels et la prime payée en partie par l'employeur qui comprennent :
  • Assurance vie pour vous et votre famille
  • Variété de spécialistes : Ostéopathe, Naturopathe, Masseur, Acupuncteur, Orthophoniste, Diététiste, Chiropraticien, Physiothérapeute, Podiatre, Psychologue, Travailleur social, etc.
  • Assistance voyage d'urgence pour vous et votre famille
  • Services et fournitures médicales tels que ambulance, prothèses auditives, chaussures orthopédiques, etc.
  • Soins de la vue, y compris examen de la vue, lunettes ou contacts
  • Services dentaires, y compris les services d'orthodontie
  • Prestations d'invalidité de courte et de longue durée

UPS Canada est un employeur inclusif et qui adhère au principe d’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Veuillez aviser un représentant des ressources humaines si une mesure d’adaptation du lieu de travail est requise. Merci de l’intérêt que vous portez à UPS Canada.

title: Assistant(e) logistique transport maritime
description:
Effectuer la fonction de service à la clientèle quotidienne selon les besoins du client.

Ce poste implique de fortes responsabilités en matière de service à la clientèle

Principales responsabilités

  • Surveiller et coordonner les expéditions, y compris la communication avec les bureaux à l'étranger, le ramassage, la livraison des marchandises ; suivi du fret, documentation, assurance et comptabilité.
  • Conseiller les clients sur les procédures d'importation de fret maritime, les réglementations internationales (ex: procédures de paiement).
  • Obtenir et produire toutes les informations pertinentes (outre-mer, documents bancaires, consulats, agences gouvernementales, etc.).
  • Organiser le transport et la documentation avec les transporteurs.
  • Produire des informations et une documentation précises dans les délais précisés.
  • Développer les relations d'affaires et faire le suivi avec les clients et partenaires (ex : transporteurs).
  • Assister les membres des agents intermédiaires et juniors dans la résolution de problèmes.
  • S'assurer que l'entreprise ferme tous les dossiers dans le délai établi.
  • Participer à l'amélioration de la qualité et des processus.

Autres exigences du poste

  • Nombre de transactions et profit par transaction,
  • saisie de données et traitement de l'information précis et en temps opportun,
  • établissement des coûts et facturation précis et en temps opportun pour la clôture des dossiers, et pleine conformité de tous les processus et exigences du service pour améliorer la satisfaction des clients.

Formation et expérience de travail

  • Diplôme d'études collégiales en logistique et transport
  • Plus de 5 ans d'expérience dans le domaine du transport
  • Bilingue (français/anglais)

Autres

  • Lieu de travail : 1221, 32e avenue, Lachine, Québec
  • Horaire de travail : du lundi au vendredi de 9h30 à 18h

UPS Supply Chain Solutions offre une rémunération globale compétitive comprenant :

  • Régime d'épargne-retraite
  • Plan d'achat d'actions d’UPS
  • Remboursement de vos frais de scolarité
  • Programme d'aide aux employés pour vous et votre famille
  • 5 + 2 jours discrétionnaires par an + vacances annuelles
  • Variété de rabais chez certains fournisseurs pour nos employés vous êtes éligible dès votre embauche.
  • Opportunités de développement et de progression de carrière dans plusieurs unités commerciales et zones géographiques d’UPS SCS.

Couverture d'avantages sociaux concurrentiels et même certaines primes payées entièrement par l’employeur qui comprend :

  • Une assurance vie pour vous et votre famille
  • Variété de spécialistes : Ostéopathe, Naturopathe, Masseur, Acupuncteur, Orthophoniste, Diététicien, Chiropraticien, Kinésithérapeute, Podiatre, Psychologue, Travailleur social, etc.
  • Assistance voyage d'urgence pour vous et votre famille
  • Services et fournitures médicaux tels qu'ambulance, appareils auditifs, chaussures orthopédiques, etc.
  • Soins de la vue, y compris examen des yeux, lunettes ou lentilles de contact
  • Services dentaires, y compris orthodontie
  • Programme d'invalidité de courte et de longue durée

Type d'emploi : Temps plein, Permanent

Salaire : à partir de 22,07$ par heure

Avantages :

  • Assurance Dentaire
  • Assurance Invalidité
  • Assurance Maladie Complémentaire
  • Assurance Vie
  • Assurance Vision
  • Bourses d'Études
  • Congés de Vacances et Compensatoires
  • Options d'Achats d'Actions
  • Programme d'Aide aux Employés
  • Réductions Tarifaires
  • Régime d'Achat d'Actions
  • Régime de retraite
  • Stationnement sur place
  • Tenue Décontractée

Horaire :

  • 8 Heures
  • Du Lundi au Vendredi
  • Quart de jour

Expérience:

  • transport maritime: 3 ans (Obligatoire)

title: Customs Brokerage Representative I
description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

Working from home

Initial training will be held in the office Nelson Road, Vancouver.

Work Schedule: Wednesday to Sunday 11pm to 6am, overnight shift.

Position Summary:

  • To process customs clearance (release) AND/OR confirm declarations for repetitive and non-complex shipments guided by the CCBS system and personal skills.Client (Internal/External):Import operations, Support Services, Consulting, Inbound services, Sales, etc, and all customs clients and partnersSpecific output or services:
  • Customs release AND/OR confirm declarations for repetitive and non-complex shipments using client' profile in CCBS system (creates or modifies line code/classification)
  • Handle delivery service AND/OR import permits requests if required AND/OR gather and send proper documentation to the government


Job Key Contributions/Task:

  • Data entry (open customers' files, validate information, credit and invoicing)
  • Collect supplementary information or documentation from customers, drivers, custom and other offices, etc, when required
  • Identify customer profiles discrepancies
  • Answer standard questions and requests from customers, drivers, customs and other offices
  • Work as team member with other actors: clients, UPS SCS employees, carriers, inbound agents


Qualifications required

  • 6 months to 2 years of experience
  • High school degree
  • Bilingualism required - intermediate level (in Quebec Only)
  • Basic knowledge in Customs operations, laws and regulations, and other government departments
  • Basic understanding of HS system
  • Basic computer skills

UPS Supply Chain Solutions offers a competitive total compensation package including:

  • Retirement savings plan
  • UPS Stock Purchase Plan
  • Reimbursement of your tuition fees
  • Employee Assistance Program for you and your family
  • 5 discretionary days per year + Annual vacation
  • Variety of discounts at certain suppliers for our employees, you are eligible as soon as you are hired.
  • Development and career progression opportunities across multiple UPS SCS business units and geographies.

Competitive benefits coverage and even some premiums paid entirely by the employer which includes:

  • Variety of specialists: Osteopath, Naturopath, Masseur, Acupuncturist, Speech therapist, Dietitian, Chiropractor, Physiotherapist, Podiatrist, Psychologist, Social worker, etc.
  • Emergency travel assistance for you and your family
  • Medical services and supplies such as ambulance, hearing aids, orthopedic shoes, etc.
  • Vision care, including eye exam, glasses or contact lenses
  • Life insurance for you and your family
  • Dental services including orthodontics
  • Short and long term disability program

UPS Canada is a diverse and equal opportunity employer. Please advise our HR representatives if workplace accommodation is needed. Thank you for your interest in UPS Canada.

title: Agent(e) au transport III
description:
Avant de postuler pour un emploi, sélectionnez votre préférence linguistique parmi les options
disponibles en haut à droite de cette page.

Explorez vos futures possibilités de carrière au sein d’une organisation figurant sur la liste mondiale des 500 plus grandes entreprises du magazine Fortune. Imaginez les possibilités novatrices, découvrez notre culture enrichissante et travaillez avec des équipes qui vous aideront à atteindre votre plein potentiel. Nous savons que, pour assurer l’avenir d’UPS, nous avons besoin de candidats possédant une combinaison unique d’aptitudes et de passion. Vous possédez les qualités nécessaires pour gérer vos activités et celles des membres d’une équipe? Nous avons des postes qui vous permettront de consolider vos acquis et de faire avancer votre carrière au prochain niveau.

Description du poste

Résumé de la position

Effectuer la fonction de service à la clientèle quotidienne selon les besoins du client.

Ce poste implique de fortes responsabilités en matière de service à la clientèle

Principales responsabilités

  • Surveiller et coordonner les expéditions, y compris la communication avec les bureaux à l'étranger, le ramassage, la livraison des marchandises ; suivi du fret, documentation, assurance et comptabilité.
  • Conseiller les clients sur les procédures d'importation de fret maritime, les réglementations internationales (ex: procédures de paiement).
  • Obtenir et produire toutes les informations pertinentes (outre-mer, documents bancaires, consulats, agences gouvernementales, etc.).
  • Organiser le transport et la documentation avec les transporteurs.
  • Produire des informations et une documentation précises dans les délais précisés.
  • Développer les relations d'affaires et faire le suivi avec les clients et partenaires (ex : transporteurs).
  • Assister les membres des agents intermédiaires et juniors dans la résolution de problèmes.
  • S'assurer que l'entreprise ferme tous les dossiers dans le délai établi.
  • Participer à l'amélioration de la qualité et des processus.

Autres exigences du poste

  • Nombre de transactions et profit par transaction,
  • saisie de données et traitement de l'information précis et en temps opportun,
  • établissement des coûts et facturation précis et en temps opportun pour la clôture des dossiers, et pleine conformité de tous les processus et exigences du service pour améliorer la satisfaction des clients.

Formation et expérience de travail

  • Diplôme d'études collégiales en logistique et transport
  • Plus de 5 ans d'expérience dans le domaine du transport
  • Bilingue (français/anglais)

Lieu de travail : 1221, 32e avenue, Lachine, Québec

Horaire de travail : du lundi au vendredi de 9h30 à 18h

UPS Supply Chain Solutions offre une rémunération globale compétitive comprenant :

  • Régime d'épargne-retraite
  • Plan d'achat d'actions d’UPS
  • Remboursement de vos frais de scolarité
  • Programme d'aide aux employés pour vous et votre famille
  • 5 + 2 jours discrétionnaires par an + vacances annuelles
  • Variété de rabais chez certains fournisseurs pour nos employés vous êtes éligible dès votre embauche.
  • Opportunités de développement et de progression de carrière dans plusieurs unités commerciales et zones géographiques d’UPS SCS.

Couverture d'avantages sociaux concurrentiels et même certaines primes payées entièrement par l’employeur qui comprend :

  • Une assurance vie pour vous et votre famille
  • Variété de spécialistes : Ostéopathe, Naturopathe, Masseur, Acupuncteur, Orthophoniste, Diététicien, Chiropraticien, Kinésithérapeute, Podiatre, Psychologue, Travailleur social, etc.
  • Assistance voyage d'urgence pour vous et votre famille
  • Services et fournitures médicaux tels qu'ambulance, appareils auditifs, chaussures orthopédiques, etc.
  • Soins de la vue, y compris examen des yeux, lunettes ou lentilles de contact
  • Services dentaires, y compris orthodontie
  • Programme d'invalidité de courte et de longue durée

UPS Canada est un employeur inclusif et qui adhère au principe d’égalité d’accès à l’emploi. Veuillez aviser un représentant des ressources humaines si une mesure d’adaptation du lieu de travail est requise. Merci de l’intérêt que vous portez à UPS Canada.

title: Administrative Assistant
description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description:

UPS Supply Chain Solutions is growing!

Join our team today!

This position is full time 40 hours per week Monday to Friday 8AM to 4.30PM or 8.30AM to 5PM.

After 90 days the UPS benefits is accessible for new employees.

Work Location: 1221, 32nd avenue, Lachine, Quebec.

Responsibilities:

  • Assist in clerical tasks: information gathering, documentation, photocopying, faxing, splitting, etc.
  • Performs data entry/scanning.
  • Answers phone calls from partners and other offices.

Qualifications:

  • Intermediate Skills Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook.
  • Strong typing skills (min. 25 words per minute)
  • Ability to read spreadsheets, sort, filter and extract information in Excel format.
  • Bilingual Intermediate level in both language French and English

UPS Supply Chain Solutions offers a competitive compensation package including:

  • Defined Contribution Pension Plan
  • Retirement Saving Plan
  • Stock Purchase Plan
  • Education Assistance Program
  • Employee Assistance Program for you and your family
  • 5+2 discretionary days per year + annual vacation days
  • Variety of store discounts for our Upsers.
  • Career development and progression opportunities across multiple business units and geographies

  • Competitive Benefits coverage and premium paid partially by the employer which include:
  • Life Insurance for you and your family
  • Variety of specialists : Osteopath, Naturopath, Masseur, Acupuncturist, Speech Therapist, Dietician, Chiropractor, Physiotherapist, Podiatrist, Psychologist, Social Worker, etc.
  • Emergency Travel Assistance for you and your family
  • Medical services and supplies such as ambulance, hearing aids, orthopedic shoes, etc.
  • Vision care including eyes exam, glasses or contacts
  • Dental Services including orthodontics services
  • Short Term and Long Term Disability benefits

UPS Canada is a diverse and equal opportunity employer. Please advise our HR representatives if workplace accommodation is needed. Thank you for your interest in UPS Canada.

title: Massage Therapist
description:
Midtown est à la recherche d'un massothérapeute pour s'assurer que les membres et les invités vivent des expériences de spa luxueuses.

Le poste

Faisant partie intégrante de l'équipe du spa, nos massothérapeutes sont des professionnels compétents et attentionnés, intéressés par le bien-être et la satisfaction personnelle de nos membres et invités. Ils connaissent les dernières tendances et techniques de massage et ont un impact positif sur le succès de notre club en démontrant les avantages du massage à nos clients.

Responsabilités Du Massothérapeute
  • Répondre aux besoins de manière professionnelle, positive et opportune
  • Organiser le poste de travail, la salle de traitement, l'éclairage, le son et se renseigner auprès du niveau de confort des clients tout au long du service
  • Maintenir la propreté des zones du spa tout au long du quart de travail, éliminer les déchets et les conduites sales et sécuriser les fournitures à la fin du quart de travail
  • Collaborer avec d'autres associés et les aider à promouvoir les services du spa et à atteindre les objectifs du service
  • Effectuer des traitements pour les clients et maintenir la propreté et les normes d'assainissement de la salle de traitement pour le confort et la sécurité des clients
  • Promouvoir les services de spa/salon et vendre des produits au détail
Exigences Du Massothérapeute
  • Au moins un an d'expérience et une licence d'état en cours
  • Certifié par une école de massothérapie crédible
  • Expérience antérieure en service à la clientèle préférée
Midtown is looking for a Massage Therapist to ensure that members and guests have luxurious spa experiences.

The Position

As an integral part of the spa team, our Massage Therapists are knowledgeable and caring professionals, interested in the well-being and personal satisfaction of our members and guests. They are skilled in the latest massage trends and techniques, and, have a positive impact on the success of our club by demonstrating the benefits of massage to our clients.

Massage Therapist Responsibilities
  • Address needs in a professional, positive, and timely manner
  • Arrange work station, treatment room, lighting, sound and inquire with guest comfort level throughout service
  • Maintain cleanliness of spa areas throughout shift, dispose of trash and dirty lines, and secure supplies at end of shift
  • Partner with and assisting other associates to promote spa services and achieve department goals
  • Perform treatments for guests and maintain treatment room cleanliness and sanitation standard for guest comfort and safety
  • Promote Spa/salon services and sell retail products
Massage Therapist Requirements
  • At least one year of experience and a current state license
  • Certified by a credible massage therapy school
  • Previous customer service experience preferred
This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.

MIDTOWN is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Massage Therapist
description:
WE ARE LOOKING FOR A part time registered massage therapist

Stillwater Spa at the Hyatt Regency Calgary strives to be the top choice for spa enthusiasts for our unparalleled level of service and expertise. We aspire to be top of mind for colleagues who wish to reach their highest potential and grow their careers by establishing a company culture that enriches our team members to be their best!

What Is Exepcted Of Me In This Role
  • Follow Stillwater Service Standards upon hiring
  • Perform Therapeutic, Relaxation and Prenatal Massage in a safe and professional manner
  • As per Association, mandate SOAP notes are to be documented for every massage service.
  • Educate guests on products and homecare
  • Maintain professional manner and positive attitude with guests and co-workers
  • Maintain current professional licenses and association memberships
  • Keep current on trends in Massage Therapy and Spa industry .
  • Available to work on Saturday and Sunday from 1030 am to 7pm
Experience And Qualifications
  • Minimum of 2 years massage experience
  • Graduated from a 2200 massage therapy program
  • Valid City of Calgary Massage Business License
  • Valid Membership to a recognized massage association
WHAT ARE THE ADDITIONAL BENEFITS TO WORKING AT THE HYATT REGENCY CALGARY?
  • Complimentary meal during shift
  • Discounts at Thomsons Kitchen/Bar
  • Discounts on Stillwater Spa Services and Spa Products
  • Paid medical days
  • Employer RRSP Matching Contributions
  • Discounted Parking
  • Complimentary hotel nights and Friends and Family discounts at Hyatt properties around the world
  • Complimentary access to our pool and Stay Fit Gym
  • Tuition reimbursement program
FIND YOUR PLACE AT HYATT

Be a part of something bigger. Enjoy life every day. Make a difference in the lives of those around you. Love where you work. Join a family that values respect, integrity, humility, empathy, creativity and fun, your perfect opportunity.

At Hyatt, diversity, equity and inclusion are at the core of our purpose, to care for people so they can be their best.

We welcome colleagues and guests from all over the world and we know that bringing diverse perspectives and underrepresented voices into the conversation strengthens our organization. There is no room for racism, discrimination or hatred of any kind at Hyatt hotels or offices.

This role will typically allow a minimum of 10 hours per week

Visit careers.hyatt.com to apply

title: Massage Therapist
description:
• revibe: We are an integrated wellness team of physiotherapists, chiropractors, massage therapists, osteopaths, kinesiologists and naturopathic doctors on a mission to empower communities through wellness. 
  • Who you are:
  • Are you a therapist passionate about making a difference in people’s lives?
  • Do you want to create an impact in your community? 
  • And would you like to surround yourself around go-getters and leaders in the wellness industry?
  • If yes, we would love to meet you!
  • Below you will find 3 personas that describes the people we help everyday to become the best version of themselves:  
  • (1) You want to become an expert/specialist in your field, but you don’t know where to start. What you need is mentorship and opportunity to grow as a person.  
  • (2) Life feels repetitive and stagnant. You are tired of doing the same thing every day without feeling like you are progressing in your career. A leadership role in community, education, or business is what you look forward to.
  • (3) You are fed up with how the industry works and want to provide quality value and education alongside like-minded individuals who challenge the status quo. 
  • Prerequisites: 1-on-1 full body approach implementing manual therapy, corrective programming and accountability coaching. 
  • While we would prefer an individual with a few years of experience, we are open to considering a new grad who aligns with our vibe.
  • What we offer:
  • 1-on-1 quality time with each client 
  • No double booked rooms
  • No passive modalities 
  • No double booked treatment sessions
  • Option for social and private rooms
  • Full reception and billing services
  • Caseload Building
  • Technical Skills and Personal Development Workshops
  • Weekly and Monthly Clinical Mentorship Opportunities
  • Continuing Educational Allowance (up to $2000)
  • Performance Bonuses 
  • Personal Branding for referrals
  • Incentive plan ($)
  • Company sponsored team outings and dinners
  • Team sports (co-ed basketball, softball, soccer, run clubs, yoga etc.)
  • Community Partner Discounts 
  • Career growth opportunities (see below)
  • Access to recovery lounge, nutrition bar, private gym. 


  • How you can grow:
  • Therapy Lead: Focus on your personal growth and become the expert therapist for your niche of choice. 
  • Therapy Director: Diversify your clinical skills and get involved in the business side of things.
  • Wellness Director: Lead, grow and empower your team and community to become the best version of themselves
  • revibe Partner: Work together to drive change and create impact in the world (local, regional or global locations)


  • Who we are:
  • We are a social wellness house. Our vision is to empower communities through wellness to optimize vitality & longevity through our personalized, evidence-based approach. 
  • Our philosophy: To create an environment for an integrated, yet personal journey that challenges the pandemic of unwellness. An social experience that is unique to each individuals’ wellness lifestyle and goals so that they can do what they love to do better, forever. 
  • Core values:
  • Work hard, play hard 
  • Hustle hard, hustle smarter 
  • Be you 
  • Pay it forward 
  • Stronger together
  • Good vibes only
  • Fail fast, learn faster


Learn more at www.revibeto.com

title: Massage Therapist
description:
Registered Massage Therapist - London, ON

CBI Health is Canada’s leading community healthcare provider, and our passionate team is at the heart of what we do. Every day, our 13,000 staff make a meaningful difference in our clients’ lives as we live the core values that define us: heart, respect, reliability, teamwork and innovation. Along with mentoring and continuous learning opportunities to help advance your career, we are building a culture of inspiration, recognition and celebration for the meaningful work our team does every day, all across the country. Join the new CBI Health and find where your better begins. Learn more at cbihealth.ca.

About Rehabilitation Services

CBI Health's Rehabilitation Services supports both the physical and mental health and well-being of Canadians from coast to coast. We offer personalized rehabilitation services to help our clients live a healthy, active and independent lifestyle. We provide community-based rehabilitation including physiotherapy, sports medicine, osteopathic and chiropractic care for our clients, helping them regain mobility and enjoy a better quality of life. Our services focus on the individual, meaning we design our treatment plans around unique needs and goals, adhering to best practices and consistently delivering the highest standards of quality care for the best possible outcomes for our clients.

About This Opportunity

Are you a skilled Registered Massage Therapist looking for a career opportunity that offers personal and professional growth? If so, CBI Health has an excellent opportunity for you to work alongside an interdisciplinary team to provide exemplary client care. As a Registered Massage Therapist at our London clinic, you’ll be able to build and grow your massage therapy business in a well-supported rehabilitation setting.

Take an inside look at what you’ll do each day
  • Follow assessments and treat clients who are referred directly for massage therapy
  • Contribute to a team that provides massage therapy to clients as part of their overall rehabilitation
  • Communicate treatment goals and expectations to the clients and the rest of the treatment team
  • Maintain records of massage therapy assessments and treatment notes
What You Need To Be Successful
  • Registration in good standing with the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario (CMTO)
  • The ability to work both independently and as part of a team
  • A commitment to facilitating clients' needs by exceeding their expectations
  • Relevant experience is a definite an asset
  • Evenings required
  • All team members are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof of vaccination upon hire or provide a valid medical exemption
What CBI Health Offers You
  • Training and mentoring from a national network of experts
  • Competitive compensation
  • Excellent administrative support, so you can focus on your patients
  • Flexible hours, which allow work-life balance and focus on quality of life
Our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion

CBI Health is committed to providing a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where everyone feels safe and accepted as their authentic selves. We actively seek qualified candidates who share our commitment to equity and inclusion and contribute to the diversification of ideas and perspectives that help us innovate and provide the best possible care to our clients.

We welcome applications from all individuals regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other characteristics that make each of us different.

In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and CBI Policies on Accommodation, a request for accommodation will be accepted as part of our hiring process. Please inform your recruiter if you have any accommodation requests.

title: Massage Therapist
description:
Luxury and tranquility in an authentic setting, await our Guests at The Fairmont Jasper Park Lodge. As a Massage Therapist our guests will enjoy the professional and personalized spa experience you offer. The expertise and attention to detail you provide during their treatment will ensure our guests have a memory to share.

Covid-19 Safety Policy: In order to keep our employees and the general public safe from the threat of Covid 19 and the rise of variants in the community, the Hotel has implemented a Covid-19 Safety Policy.

What Is In It For You
  • $1000 Bonus to assist with Relocation, paid upon first pay period after Orientation. Minimum 12 month commitment required, otherwise repayment will be necessary upon resignation.
  • Competitive wage includes hourly rate + commission + service charge (Starting at $65.63 per treatment based on a basic 60 minute service, up to $93.93 per high end 90 minute service)
  • 8% Retail commission and product incentives
  • Paid Vacation / Flexible Schedule Options
  • Complimentary health club access (includes fitness centre, steam, sauna) and boat house rentals
  • Subsidized staff accommodation provided on-site for full time status
  • Competitive extended benefits package including medical, vision and dental for full time permanent status
  • Employee Travel Program
  • Comprehensive Wellness Platform (LifeWorks)
  • Discounts on food & beverage/spa/golf
  • Opportunity to develop your talent and grow within Fairmont Jasper Park Lodge and over 5,000 properties with Accor
What You Will Be Doing

Reporting to the Spa Director, responsibilities and essential job functions include but are not limited to the following:
  • Consistently offer professional, friendly and engaging service
  • Follow departmental policies and procedures
  • Perform all 30, 45, 60, 90 and 120 minute massage and body treatments as trained
  • Ensure individualized guest service through acknowledging and responding to needs and expectation while maintaining the clients comfort at all times
  • Maintain clean, hygienic and neat work environment at all times, ensuring all equipment in safe working order
  • Adhere to Body Tech safety procedures and practices and departmental Emergency Procedures/Safety Manual
  • Actively participate in learning spa's operations, i.e. body treatments, product knowledge, retail sales, Energy Masters Program
  • Assist guests regarding hotel facilities in an informative and helpful way
  • Support other teams within department as required, i.e. Spa Attendants, Spa Reception
  • Other duties as assigned
Your Experience And Skills Include
  • Previous experience as a Massage Therapist required
  • Certification from an accredited school of Massage required, 2200 hour course is required (Certified Registered Massage Therapist)
  • Registered within province of Alberta prior to beginning employment
  • Current professional licenses
  • CPR and First Aid certification is required
  • Excellent communication and organizational skills
  • Strong interpersonal and problem solving abilities
  • Highly responsible & reliable
  • Ability to work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to work cohesively with fellow colleagues as part of a team with minimum supervision
  • Ability to focus attention on guest needs, remaining calm and courteous at all times
Your Team And Working Environment
  • Fast-paced, upscale, luxury hotel
  • Close proximity to Marmot Basin Ski Resort in winter and world-renowned hiking trails in summer
  • Hospitality employees worldwide making this a great place to develop lifelong connections
  • Sitting – 1-8 hrs/day
  • Walking: 1-3 hrs/day
  • Standing: 3-4 hrs/day
  • Bending/Reaching: 1-3 hrs/day
  • Pushing/Pulling: 1-2 hrs/day
  • Physical effort: medium – required to lift up to 40 lbs
Visa Requirements: Must be legally eligible to work in Canada. The hotel is unable to assist candidates in obtaining Canadian work authorization.

Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

We are an inclusive company and our ambition is to attract, recruit and promote diverse talent.

Why work for AccorHotels?

We are much more than a world leader. We are more than 250,000 hoteliers with a purposeful and heartfelt mission: to make every guest Feel Welcome in our 4,500 addresses and on our digital platforms. We are committed to a culture and guided by our values that make our talent Feel Valued. We want them to express their passions every day and realize their full potential through exemplary professional development and growth opportunities, enjoying a life filled with unlimited experiences. To connect with us, please visit https://www.accorhotels.jobs/home.aspx

title: Dual Therapist – PT Massage, Facials, Nails Required
description:
Summary

Provide massage services to guests using props and/or products. Provide body treatments to guests using body scrubs, wraps, and/or hydrotherapy. Assess guest needs and inquire about contraindications allergies, high blood pressure, and pregnancy) before beginning service. Keep up to date with current techniques and modalities related to their field of work. Escort guests to and from treatment rooms. Arrange workstation, treatment room, and/or drapes. Frequently check with guest to promote comfort, safety and security throughout service. Promote and sell spa/salon services including retail offerings related to the Spa. Clean, maintain, and sterilize tools. Maintain cleanliness of workstation and/or treatment room throughout shift, dispose of trash and dirty linens, and secure supplies and equipment at the end of each shift. Monitor and stick to time schedule throughout the day. Handle inappropriate guest behavior by following Marriott International standard operating procedures for Inappropriate conduct for guests and therapists, leading up to and including stopping a treatment or service and informing supervisor/manager. Maintain current skills and licensure in service area as per regional requirements.

Report accidents, injuries, and unsafe work conditions to manager; complete safety training and certifications. Follow all company policies and procedures; make sure uniform and personal appearance are clean and professional; maintain confidentiality of proprietary information; protect company assets. Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards; anticipate and address guests’ service needs; thank guests with genuine appreciation. Speak with others using clear and professional language. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with others. Stand, sit, or walk for an extended period of time; grasp, turn, and manipulate objects of varying size and weight. Move, lift, carry, push, pull, and place objects weighing less than or equal to 10 pounds without assistance. Grasp, turn, and manipulate objects of varying size and weight, requiring fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination. Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors.

At Marriott, we are committed to putting our associates first and their health and safety are our highest priorities. This position requires associates to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 per current Public Health Agency of Canada standards or approved for a Human Rights accommodation.

title: Massage Therapist
description:
At Rise, we provide patients with a welcoming and comfortable environment for treating all types of physical pains, aches and injuries.

Our professionals use evidence-based practice to provide personalized treatment plans in our private treating rooms. Offering services like chiropractic, physiotherapy, massage therapy, acupuncture, naturopathic medicine and so much more, Rise is committed to providing our patients the best results!

What we offer

-competitive split compensation 

- flexible schedule (days and hours)

-A collaborative multidisciplinary team that offer internal patient referral  

-Private treatment rooms

-Free onsite parking

-full-time receptionist to take care off all the admin work

-PPE and supplies provided 

What we require from you 

-Registration, in good standing, the regulatory body (college/association)

-active license and insurance

-Dedication to grow and learn as a practitioner, as well as provide exceptional treatment to help patients feel their best


If this is an opportunity that interests you, please do not hesitate to reach out

title: Massage Therapist - Calgary
description:
Panther Sports Medicine

Massage Therapist, Part-time - Calgary, Deer Valley

The hours for this position are flexible, mornings or afternoons, Monday, Thursday, and Friday.

About This Opportunity

Are you a skilled Massage Therapist looking for a career opportunity that offers personal and professional growth? If so, Panther Sports Medicine has an excellent opportunity for you to work alongside an interdisciplinary team to provide exemplary client care. As a Registered Massage Therapist at our Deer Valley clinic, you’ll be able to build and grow your massage therapy business in a well-supported rehabilitation setting.

We are seeking a flexible, enthusiastic and personable team player who is focused on client-centred care and clinical outcomes. You will oversee and manage an existing caseload, while sharpening your caseload building skills through our broad network of referral sources.

Panther Sports Medicine & Rehabilitation has been providing expert care since 1987 and is a leader in the delivery of acute rehabilitation in the Calgary area. We specialize in orthopedic rehabilitation, sports medicine, MVA, and work-related injury rehabilitation offering additional services in spinal rehabilitation, vestibular therapy, massage therapy, acupuncture, intramuscular stimulation (IMS), cranio-sacral therapy, orthotics, and custom braces.

Come grow your career with Panther Sports Medicine!

To apply, email your resume to Heather Kardal - hkardal@cbihealth.ca

Take an inside look at what you’ll do each day
  • Follow assessments and treat clients who are referred directly for massage therapy
  • Contribute to a team that provides massage therapy to clients as part of their overall rehabilitation
  • Communicate treatment goals and expectations to the clients and the rest of the treatment team
  • Maintain records of massage therapy assessments and treatment notes
What You Need To Be Successful
  • Be a graduate of a recognized Massage Therapist program
  • Registration that is in good standing with a recognized Massage Therapist association for practice in Alberta
  • The ability to work both independently and as part of a team
  • A commitment to facilitating clients' needs by exceeding their expectations
  • Relevant experience is a definite an asset
  • Evenings required
  • All team members are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and provide proof of vaccination upon hire or provide a valid medical exemption
What CBI Health - Panther Sports Medicine can offer you:
  • Education and professional development opportunities
  • Competitive compensation
  • Continuous growth opportunities
  • Excellent administrative support, so you can focus on your patients
  • Flexible hours, which allow work-life balance and focus on quality of life
About Us

Panther Sports Medicine & Rehabilitation is now a proud division of CBI Health. Discover what's new at CBI Health

CBI Health - Panther Sports Medicine operates ten state-of-the-art rehabilitation centres in Calgary, providing convenient access for clients in all areas of the city. Centres are staffed with highly trained professionals who provide clinical excellence and exceptional customer service. We offer clients extended operating hours and locations in recreation centres, medical buildings, and plazas, clients can easily access their best-in-class services to restore and maximize their physical health.

CBI Health is committed to providing a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace where everyone feels safe and accepted as their authentic selves. We actively seek qualified candidates who share our commitment to equity and inclusion and contribute to the diversification of ideas and perspectives that help us innovate and provide the best possible care to our clients.

We welcome applications from all individuals regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or any other characteristics that make each of us different.

title: Massage Therapist
description:
Nordik Spa-Nature

For those who dream of being somewhere else, Nordik Spa Nature is a haven of well-being. Offering the largest selection of mind and body wellness experiences in North America, Nordik Nature Spa allows you to reconnect with the elements, with each other and with yourself. It offers a refuge from modern life and a chance to give life a break.

Join us!

When you work at Nordik Spa-Nature, you don't just earn a job, you find a family. We pride ourselves on having one of the warmest and most welcoming communities and our guests truly appreciate it. We strive to provide excellent care to our guests and ensure the well-being of our employees who are our craftsmen.

Who We Are

Our mission is to give our guests a moment of respite by providing a refuge from the pressures of modern life where they can rediscover their own well-being and, as a result, live happier, longer lives. Your role as a craftsman in our nature spa is to cultivate peace. Here at Nordik Spa-Nature, we are a passionate and dedicated team. We are always enthusiastic, helpful, conscientious, discreet and above all respectful. We care deeply about each and every guest and fellow craftsman in our wellness spa.

What We Want

We are looking for massage therapists who are passionate about wellness and who, thanks to their skills, will be able to contribute to the achievement of the company's mission.

The incumbent, being self-employed, is responsible for practicing different types of massage therapy treatments. He/she greets the client and performs the services and ensures that the spa's customer service standards are respected. He/she advises and responds to clients' requests, ensuring excellent service and a memorable client experience.

What You Will Do
  • Offer different types of massages to clients while respecting the protocols established by the company;
  • Answer clients' questions and provide excellent customer service;
  • Ensure that clients enjoy an impeccable spa experience;
  • Ensure the cleanliness of the workplace and specifically the massage rooms.
Profile Required
  • Have completed a minimum of 1,000 hours in a recognized educational institution;
  • Be a member in good standing of a recognized professional association in Quebec (provide proof of certification with your curriculum vitae);
  • Have professional liability insurance;
  • Bilingualism (French and English), essential;
  • Experience in massage therapy, essential;
  • Relevant experience in customer service is an asset;
  • Ability to maintain good relationships with clients and colleagues;
  • Ability to communicate clearly with clients, managers and associates.
  • Physical fitness; Ability to work many hours on your feet, ability to bend and stretch.
Salary

According to the salary scale in effect plus benefits related to Nordik Spa-Nature.

Work schedule

40 hours per week; schedule may vary day, evening and weekend.

To apply

Send us your resumé and cover letter by visiting our web site in the career section

https://workforcenow.adp.com/mascsr/default/mdf/recruitment/recruitment.html?cid=b0ed2582-382c-4558-a5a6-be185625046e&ccId=168215231511_9449&type=MP&lang=fr_CA

title: Certified Massage Therapist
description:
For a position with us, you must be passionate about Thai Culture and providing ultimate customer experiences; have a positive attitude and high expectations for yourself.

This position will require you to administer a variety of treatments to our clients according to the protocols and procedures provided by Lanna Thai, attend training sessions, and act as a true team player.
Successful Candidates will be goal-oriented, flexible, reliable, dedicated, learning-minded, passionate, professional, and able to work days or evenings and weekends.

Minimum experience required: 2 years
Salary: Negotiable based on skills and experience
Essential Qualifications: 1000 hours or in progress
Required Certifications: Thai Massage, Tok-Sen, Kobiyoko, Herbal Herbs, Deep Tissue, Healing, Reflexology, Foot massage
Avaible on Tuesdays, Thursdays & Saturdays

Lanna Thai Massage is an equal opportunity employer and we thank all interested candidates for their application; only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Massage Therapist
description: New Balance Chiropractic Clinic is seeking a chiropractor to join the practice. Our office is looking for a part-time or full time chiropractor to join our team. This opportunity is available for a new graduate or a doctor with an existing practice Located in downtown Edmonton we are seeking a dynamic, professional, and driven chiropractor to join our team. New chiropractic patients experience a detailed health consultation and examination to develop an appropriate treatment plan. A skill set of Diversified, activator, Graston and A.R.T. are an asset. The clinic also provides massage therapy, acupuncture, administrative support, direct billing, and an active patient base. If you are a dedicated professional, motivated and have a passion for what you do, please contact us.

The hours for this position are flexible. We are requesting someone part time to cover 2-3 shifts per week. Our priority is availability on Wednesdays between 8am and 3pm and Thursdays between 8am and 6pm. Tuesdays and Fridays are also available but not required, 8am to 12pm.

title: Massage therapist
description:
As a wellness pioneer, Life Time is reshaping the way consumers approach their health by integrating where we move, work and live – digitally and physically – all with the primary goal of helping people lead healthy, happy lives. Life Time is committed to an inclusive culture that welcomes and respects everyone. We promote an inviting community that supports all people on their path to a healthy way of life.

WE ARE CONFIDENCE. It’s what we offer to every client we help look and feel amazing, and it’s how we exemplify ourselves as a community built on love, loyalty and a healthy way of life. LifeSpa is the largest full-service salon and spa in the nation, and we’re looking for talented artists to join us. What does it mean to join our team? Continued investment in your education, industry-leading compensation, flexible scheduling, a built-in book of leads, an incredible benefits package and free membership to Life Time – including yoga, Pilates and group fitness classes.

Job Description

Position Summary

The Massage Therapist provides various massage therapy services and treatments that compliments fitness programs, improves overall sense of well-being, and enhances the guest’s fitness experience while living the mission, vision and core values of LifeSpa and Salon . They work to build relationships with other departments in the club and educate on benefits of massage therapy. They are responsible to designing sessions around guests specific needs and suggest massage schedules for recurring sessions. They work with the entire LifeSpa and Salon team to provide a superior experience in a professional atmosphere.

Job Duties And Responsibilities
  • Greets and services members in a friendly and professional manner
  • Provides individualized massage therapy services and treatments that meet the clients’ needs and expectations
  • Initiates, develops and maintains personalized relationships with clients
  • Educates clients on LifeSpa and Salon products, services and treatments
  • Maintains LifeSpa and Salon appearance and cleanliness
  • Serves as an expert in muscle and body analysis and maintenance regimens
  • Promotes and sells massage therapy services and treatments and encourages repeat business
  • Remains current on certifications and new trends in the industry
Position Requirements
  • High School Diploma or GED
  • Massage Therapy License
  • Ability to perform all types of massage therapy services and treatments
  • Ability to calculate figures such as discounts, interest, commissions, and proportions
  • Knowledge of basic PC operating
  • Ability to stand, walk, reach and lift and move up to 50 pounds
Preferred Requirements
  • 2 years of massage experience in a professional environment
  • Knowledge of body treatments
  • Experience with Salon Biz
If you are contacted regarding a job opportunity, please let us know of any accommodations needed to meet your accessibility needs during the recruitment process. Any accommodation information will be treated as confidential and only used for the purpose of enabling you to have an accessible candidate experience.

Life Time is a place for everyone. As an organization, we are committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace that respects and celebrates the unique contributions of each individual while ensuring we remain an equal opportunity employer that recruits, hires, trains and promotes based on merit and qualifications.

title: Full Time Massage Therapist for a Day Spa in Canada .
description:
You must be permitted to work in this country.

Minimum experience required: over 2 years.

Salary: $29.00 per hour – 40 hours per week.

Location: Gatineau, CA

Start date: Open Ended

Details

Business information: We embody the wellness culture of a tropical paradise, located along the Ott...

Business information: We embody the wellness culture of a tropical paradise, located along the Ottawa River with an environment that promotes full body and soul resourcing; the Spa offers a variety of massage services, beauty treatments and several other spa treatments in a relaxing Hawaiian atmosphere. Aloha!

Business Address

Work Location: Same as above

Type of Employment: Full time - Permanent

Estimated Start Date: As soon as possible

Job Description
  • Administer massage techniques
  • Maintain records of treatments given
  • Explain procedures, risks and benefits to clients
  • Massage and knead muscles and soft tissues of the body
  • Apply finger and hand pressure to specific points of the body
  • Establish the health check with the client
Requirements
  • Education: Completion of an 18- to 24-month or 18- to 36-month program in massage therapy from an accredited school or in a related discipline is required.
  • At least 2 years of experience or supervised practical training are required.
  • Massage techniques required: Swedish and therapeutic
  • Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities: Repetitive tasks, Standing for extended periods, Physically demanding, Manual dexterity
Personal Suitability: Interpersonal awareness, Effective interpersonal skills, Values and ethics, Client focus, Accurate, Excellent oral communication
  • Languages: French and English are required.
Salary: $29.00 per hour – 40 hours per week.

Important Information: The position requires extended working hours and flexibility in planning; including morning, day, evening, night or weekend hours, as needed. The candidate will work 6 to 8 hours a day within the following schedule depending on the needs of the company: Monday to Sunday, between 10h and 20h30. The candidate will be entitled to a weekly rest period of at least 32 consecutive hours.

Benefits: Gratuities, RRSP benefits

title: Massotherapist
description:
L’Absolu SPA recrute!

Nous sommes un SPA intérieur situé à Montréal offrant de la massothérapie, des bains flottants ainsi qu'un Sauna finlandais. Nos preuves sont faites, nous comptons plus de 13000 client(e)s nous faisant confiance depuis 23 belles années.

Pour faire face à la demande grandissante, L'Absolu SPA est présentement à la recherche d'un(e) massothérapeute qualifié(e) qui pourra se joindre à sa belle grande équipe !

Nous recherchons une personne dynamique, ayant une formation reconnue.

Une personne de confiance, zen, chaleureuse et surtout passionnée de la massothérapie.

L’Absolu SPA offre un environnement convivial et professionnel et des conditions de travail permettant aux massothérapeutes d’acquérir une expérience unique.

Avantages:

Excellente rémunération
Pourboires généreux et remis en entier
Horaire flexible
Conciliation travail, famille, étude
30 minutes entre les massages, accommodement possible
Accès au sauna et bain flottant gratuitement pour vous et votre conjoint(e)
Environnement enrichissant
Ambiance et milieu de travail dynamique et agréable
Stationnement non-payant et accessible
Enorme clientèle diversifiée et fidèle
Possibilité d’échange de service entre employés
Réceptionniste à la réception en tout temps durant les heures d’ouvertures
Poste travailleur autonome ou salarié
Exigences:

Détenir un diplôme en massothérapie d’une école reconnue
Posséder une accréditation d'une association reconnue
Être passionnée par le bien-être des gens et désirer ardemment offrir une expérience absolue
L'Absolu SPA

514 383-6363

---

L'Absolu SPA is recruiting!

We are an indoor SPA located in Montreal offering massage therapy, floating baths and a Finnish Sauna. We have proven ourselves, we have more than 10,000 clients who have trusted us for 23 years.

To meet the growing demand, L'Absolu SPA is currently looking for a qualified massage therapist to join its great team!

We are looking for a dynamic person with a recognized training.

A person of confidence, zen, warm and especially passionate about massage therapy.

L'Absolu SPA offers a friendly and professional environment and working conditions that allow massage therapists to acquire a unique experience.

Benefits:

Excellent compensation
Generous gratuities, paid in full
Flexible schedule
Work, family and study balance
30 minutes between massages, accommodations possible
Free access to the sauna and floatation bath for you and your spouse
Enriching environment
Dynamic and pleasant work environment
Free and accessible parking
Diversified and loyal clientele
Possibility of exchange of services between employees
Receptionist at the front desk at all times during business hours
Self-employed or salaried position
Requirements:

Diploma in massage therapy from a recognized school
Accreditation from a recognized association
Be passionate about the well-being of people and have a strong desire to offer an absolute experience

title: Massage Therapy Instructor/Clinic Supervisor - Moncton
description:
Eastern College Inc. is actively seeking an experienced Registered Massage Therapist, interested in joining the Moncton campus team to be a Massage Therapy Clinic Supervisor.

Primary Responsibilities

The Instructor provide quality delivery of assigned Massage Therapy courses utilizing a variety of instruction strategies, techniques and delivery methods to meet the individual learning styles of the students, in a safe and civil learning environment. Instructors are responsible for teaching assigned courses in accordance with course competencies, taking daily attendance, and grading class tests, assignments, and exams.

The Clinic Supervisor provides instruction, guidance and mentoring to students as they move from the textbook to the hands-on practical clinic setting. In addition, the Clinic Supervisor manages the daily operations of the massage therapy clinic.

You will support the vision, mission, and values of Eastern College while contributing to a positive, supportive and student-focused team environment of respect, integrity, dedication and readiness; embracing diversity and fostering inclusion.

Qualifications
  • Registered as a Massage Therapist in Good Standing with the provincial regulatory body (ex. College of Massage Therapists of New Brunswick (CMTNB)).
  • Massage Therapy diploma.
  • Minimum of 2 years of practical work experience as a Registered Massage Therapist.
  • Adult education and teaching experience preferred.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications and use of the Internet.
  • Understanding of Adult Learning Principles is preferred.
Hours Of Work

This is a part-time on-going position.

The instructor will be teaching June 6 - July 1 8:00 am - 12:00 pm Monday to friday, than transition into our clinic as the supervisor for our students 1:00 pm - 7:00 pm on an ongoing basis.

Start Date

The scheduled start for this opportunity is May 23.

About Eastern College

Eastern College and its subsidiaries are committed to building an intentionally inclusive environment that engages, supports, and empowers diversity and belonging in the workplace and communities served and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.

Eastern College Inc. is a leader in the Private Career College industry in Atlantic Canada. Established in 1983 we have delivered training in a modular approach to students to enable them to fast-track to job readiness.

Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
