title: Massothérapeute
description:
Joignez-vous à nous et mettez votre talent et votre passion à contribution au sein d’une équipe dynamique et passionnée.

Les avantages de faire partie de l’équipe Moment Spa :

Taux horaire avantageux

Primes (prime week-end, massages spécialisés, etc), commissions et pourboires élevés

Prime de référencement

Congés de maladie, parentaux, fériés, vacances et formations payées

Horaire flexible facilitant la conciliation travail-vie personnelle

Uniforme fourni, souliers payés

Rabais sur les soins et les produits, rabais pour la famille immédiate et plus encore…

Votre journée sera riche et variée; ce qui ne laisse aucune place à la monotonie. Accueil et conseil des clients, préparation des cabines et des massages à effectuer, réalisation de soins corporels font partie des différentes missions possibles.

Excellent service à la clientèle – Aptitude à optimiser l’expérience client - Empathie et entregent - Facilité à conseiller les services et produits personnalisés selon les besoins

title: Massothérapeute
description:
Nordik Spa-Nature

Pour ceux qui rêvent d'être ailleurs, le Nordik Spa Nature est un havre de bien-être. Offrant le plus grand choix d'expériences dédiées au bien-être du corps et de l'esprit en Amérique du Nord, le Nordik Spa Nature vous permet de renouer avec les éléments, les autres et vous-même. Il offre un refuge pour échapper à la vie moderne et offre la possibilité de donner à la vie un moment de répit.

Joignez-vous à nous!

Lorsque vous travaillez au Nordik Spa-Nature, vous trouvez une famille. Nous sommes fiers que notre communauté soit l'une des plus chaleureuses et des plus accueillantes et nos invités l'apprécient vraiment. Nous mettons tout en œuvre pour offrir d'excellents soins à notre clientèle et assurons le bien-être de nos employés qui sont nos artisans.

Ce que nous sommes

Notre mission est de donner à nos invités un moment de répit en leur offrant un refuge, loin des pressions de la vie moderne, où ils peuvent redécouvrir leur propre bien-être et, par conséquent, vivre une vie plus heureuse et plus longue. Votre rôle en tant qu'artisan de notre spa-nature est de cultiver la paix. Ici, au Nordik Spa-Nature, nous formons une équipe passionnée et dévouée. Nous sommes toujours enthousiastes, serviables, consciencieux, discrets et surtout respectueux. Nous nous soucions profondément de chacun des invités et collègues artisans dans notre spa de bien-être.

Ce que nous voulons

Nous sommes à la recherche de massothérapeutes, passionnés de mieux-être qui, grâce à leurs compétences, sauront contribuer à la réalisation de la mission de l’entreprise.

Le titulaire étant un travailleur autonome, est responsable de pratiquer différents types de traitements de massothérapie. Il/elle accueille le client et performe les services et s’assure de respecter les normes du service à la clientèle du spa. Il/elle conseille et répond aux demandes des clients en assurant un excellent service et une expérience client mémorable.

Ce que vous ferez
  • Offrir différents types de massages aux clients en respectant les protocoles établis par l’entreprise ;
  • Répondre aux questions des clients et assurer un excellent service à la clientèle ;
  • Veiller à ce que la clientèle profite d’une expérience Spa impeccable ;
  • Assurer la propreté du lieu du travail et spécifiquement les salles de massages.
Profil recherché
  • Avoir compléter un minimum de 1 000 heures dans un établissement d’enseignement reconnu ;
  • Être membre en règle d’une association professionnelle reconnue au Québec (fournir une preuve d’attestation avec le curriculum vitae) ;
  • Avoir une assurance responsabilité professionnelle ;
  • Bilinguisme (français et anglais), essentiel ;
  • Expérience en massothérapie, essentielle ;
  • Expérience pertinente en service à la clientèle est un atout ;
  • Capacité à entretenir de bonnes relations avec les clients et ses collègues ;
  • Capacité à communiquer clairement avec les clients, les gestionnaires et associés.
  • Être en bonne forme physique ; capacité de travailler de nombreuses heures debout, capacité de se pencher et d’effectuer des mouvements d’étirements.
Rémunération

Selon une entente de service pour travailleur autonome.

Horaire de travail

Horaire variable de jours, soirs, fins de semaines et jours fériés.

Pour postuler

Veuillez nous faire parvenir votre C.V. et votre lettre de motivation en visitant notre site web sous l'onglet "Carrière":

https://workforcenow.adp.com/mascsr/default/mdf/recruitment/recruitment.html?cid=b0ed2582-382c-4558-a5a6-be185625046e&ccId=168215231511_9449&type=JS&lang=fr_CA
skills: ['Assurer la propreté du lieu du travail et spécifiquement les salles de massages.']

title: Massage Therapy instructor - Mississauga
description:
triOS College is actively seeking an experienced Registered Massage Therapist, interested in joining the Mississauga Campus team to teach within our Massage Therapy proragm.

Primary Responsibilities

The primary responsibilities of this position are to provide quality delivery of assigned Massage Therapy courses utilizing a variety of instruction strategies, techniques and delivery methods to meet the individual learning styles of the students, in a safe and civil learning environment. Instructors are responsible for teaching assigned courses in accordance with course competencies, taking daily attendance, and grading class tests, assignments, and exams.

The Massage Therapy Instructor will support the vision, mission, and values of triOS College while contributing to a positive, supportive and student-focused team environment of respect, integrity, dedication and readiness; embracing diversity and fostering inclusion

Qualifications
  • Registered Massage Therapist in Good Standing with the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario (CMTO)
  • Minimum of 2-years practical experience.
  • Intermediate MS Office skills.
  • Previous teaching experience would be considered an asset.
  • Excellent English communication skills, organizational skills, and a professional attitude are required.
Hours Of Work

This is a part-time position. Hours of work will be 8am – 12pm, Monday to Friday

Start Date

The scheduled start for this opportunity is immediate.

About TriOS College

triOS College Business Technology Healthcare Inc. is a Canadian owned Registered Private Career College in Ontario. At triOS we strive to be the very best at what we do, both in the eyes of our students and coworkers. It is the dedication of our employees that has resulted in triOS as being recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies for 11 consecutive years. Our college was founded on familial values and these have been retained for the last 29 years. We are truly a team in every sense and work collaboratively towards our common goal of preparing job-ready graduates. Our teams are highly motivated and passionate about the work they do and the impact they have on changing the lives of each student that studies at the college. A career at triOS provides you with an opportunity to truly make a difference in the community. We look forward to connecting with you!

triOS Corporation and its subsidiaries are committed to building an intentionally inclusive environment that engages, supports, and empowers diversity and belonging in the workplace and communities served and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.

Please note the successful candidate will be required to complete a criminal background check. Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted

title: Massothérapeute
description:
Description Du Poste

À titre de travailleur autonome, le titulaire de l’emploi prodigue des soins en utilisant un ensemble de techniques manuelles.

PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS
  • Représenter le VVV dans le cadre de ses activités et s’assurer de l’entière satisfaction des clients;
  • Réviser le bilan de santé des clients avant le début des soins;
  • Effectuer les massages selon les techniques appropriées et la demande du client (massages suédois, massages de femmes enceintes, etc.);
  • Utiliser l’équipement et les produits nécessaires aux soins;
  • Veille à la propreté et à la sécurité de son poste de travail et maintenir une provision adéquate des fournitures nécessaires;
  • Appliquer avec rigueur les standards d’hygiène et de stérilisation.
COMPÉTENCES ET QUALIFICATION
  • Formation reconnue par la Fédération québécoise des massothérapeutes
  • Membre d’une association professionnelle reconnue (accréditée)
  • Plus de 1 an jusqu’à 3 ans d’expérience en massothérapie
  • Maîtrise de la langue française et anglaise
PROFIL RECHERCHÉ
  • Faire preuve de professionnalisme
  • Posséder une bonne écoute
  • Faire preuve d’autonomie, de courtoisie et d’entregent
  • Posséder un sens du toucher développé
  • Posséder une bonne agilité physique
  • Posséder une bonne endurance physique

Nombre de poste(s) disponible(s) : 2

Spa mobile est la solution familiale en massothérapie à domicile au Québec! Notre plateforme en ligne, synchronisée avec votre calendrier mobile, vous offre la liberté de gérer votre propre horaire, la flexibilité de travailler dans votre région et l’opportunité d’augmenter vos revenus. * Notez vous devez vous déplacer à Montréal.

Exigences

Vous désirez travaillez à votre rythme, avoir votre propre territoire, horaire et augmentez vos revenus? Vous êtes massothérapeute agréé, mais n’avez pas travaillé dans ce domaine depuis longtemps (changement d’emploi ou congé de maternité prolongé) ? Ou peut-être êtes-vous un nouveau massothérapeute et manquez de confiance en vous.

Pas de soucis, j’ai traversé tout cela, je suis massothérapeute depuis 2005 et ce n’était pas tout blanc. Je souhaite la bienvenue à ceux qui veulent réussir et je vous soutiendrai en tant que «coach». Je vais vous donner les outils pour réussir, vous pouvez venir avec moi et nous ne ferons que des massages en couple et en famille ensemble, jusqu’à ce que vous vous sentiez à l’aise pour le faire vous-même.

Nos clients sont majoritairement anglophones, l’anglais est donc indispensable. Comme il s’agit d’un service à domicile, vous aurez généralement plus d’une personne dans le même foyer.

Vous pouvez nous suivre sur Instagram et vous faire une idée : @spamobilemontreal

Statut et conditions

Avantages Pour Les Massothérapeutes

Salaire concurrentiel de 60$/heure ;

Gestion de votre horaire ;

Plateforme en ligne synchronisée à votre calendrier mobile ;

Choix des régions où vous aimeriez travailler *Montréal ;

Aucune préoccupation concernant la publicité, la prise de rendez-vous et le paiement. ;

Nous pouvons également vous aider à vous inscrire en tant que travailleur autonome si ce n’est pas encore le cas. ;

Entrainement en cours, Nous donnons des formations continues ;

Vous pouvez commencer par faire des massages en couple et en famille avec un autre massothérapeute jusqu’à ce que vous vous sentiez à l’aise pour le faire seul. ;

Plusieurs ajouts au massage qui aident à augmenter les ventes.

Contact

Claudia Lasante Lajeunesse 514 963-0905 Par téléphone ou SMS

claudia@spa-mobile.com

title: Massage Therapy Instructor
description:
Job Title Massage Therapy InstructorDepartment InstructorLocation North Bay, OntarioReports to Campus DirectorSupervises No supervisory duties

Job Summary

As an instructor in the Massage Therapy program, you are an Registered Massage Therapist in good standing with the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario with a minimum two years of clinical experience. Your role is primarily to instruct and deliver the subject content in a manner that engages, stimulates and fosters student learning.

Reporting to the Campus Director, the Massage Therapy program instructor is responsible for course delivery and student evaluation as set out in the Massage Therapy curriculum. This responsibility includes planning lessons and organizing instructional resources to facilitate the achievement of the course learning outcomes. The Massage Therapy program instructor is responsible for the assessment of these learning outcomes. The incumbent assists in duties that support the operation of the program and contributes positively to the program by demonstrating commitment, cooperation, flexibility, and professional and appropriate behavior.

Duties and Responsibilities

Academic
  • Ensure students are being taught in accordance with approved curriculum
  • Foster an environment of co-operation and co-ordination among instructional staff
  • Participate in the student appeal process when required
Administrative
  • Assist with tracking student hours in accordance with college procedures
  • Attend graduation ceremonies
  • Implement and follow the policies and procedures established by the College
  • Participate in meetings with staff when required
  • Participate in student orientations
  • Maintain proper records of student meetings
  • Submit monthly reports to the program coordinator
Instructional
  • Teach students using a systematic plan that consists of lectures, demonstrations, discussion groups, interactive activities, independent and group projects
  • Inform students, beforehand, of the basis upon which their performance will be evaluated;
  • Organize and effectively use classroom time
  • Use instruction techniques/methods that recognize and take into account needs and learning capacities of students
  • Modify techniques during instruction in response to the needs of the students
  • Assist students in developing efficient learning skills and work habits
  • Ensure all course objectives and modules are taught according to the program schedules
  • Implement course outlines and daily breakdowns
  • Modify course outlines in light of the needs of the students
  • Establish an appropriate atmosphere in the classroom which is conducive to learning
  • Maintain fair, firm and consistent discipline with the students
  • Regularly monitor student progress and adjust courses accordingly
  • Prepare teaching materials and outlines for courses
  • Prepare, administer and mark tests and papers to evaluate students’ progress
  • Provide individualized tutorial or remedial instruction to students who require it
  • Supervise independent or group projects
  • Base the evaluation of students on the guidelines established by the College
  • Ensure that the evaluation of students is appropriate;
  • Keep accurate and complete records of student performance
  • Ensure all evaluation records are regularly updated on the college’s electronic server;
  • Prepare final examinations in accordance with guidelines established on the course outline
  • Provide timely feedback to students regarding academic progress
Other
  • Maintain complete and accurate documentation in areas of responsibility
  • Maintain professional registration through your governing body
  • Other duties as assigned by Supervisor
Qualifications

Education

The successful candidate needs to be a Registered Massage Therapist in good standing with the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario(CMTO) and hold a current membership with the provincial massage therapy association (RMTAO).

Experience

The successful candidate requires a minimum of 24 months of working experience in their field of study to qualify as an industry instructor.

Knowledge
  • Familiar with Private Career Colleges
  • Private Career Colleges Act
  • Accessibility of Ontarians Disability Act – Customer Service Standard
Skills
  • Microsoft Office Suite
  • Microsoft Outlook
  • Google Mail, Docs, and Calendar
  • Skype
  • Moodle
Abilities
  • Work with competing priorities and deadlines
  • Deliver lectures
  • Conduct yourself professionally at all times
  • Communicate with internal staff and external community members
Working Conditions
  • Position location: North Bay, Ontario
  • Work environment: Classroom setting and clinic
  • Hours of work: Will vary, depending on class schedule
  • Schedule of work: Monday to Friday, to be arranged with Campus Director
Compensation

The successful candidate can expect a starting range between $28.00 – $33.00 per hour.

APPLICATION PROCESS

Please submit your cover letter and resume to jobs@ctsccc.com and identify the position and location that you are applying for in the subject line.

CTS Canadian Career College and Modern College of Hairstyling and Esthetics is an equal opportunity employer.

description:

Date de parution : 30 mars 2022

Entreprise : Sensia Santé

Ville : Montréal

Nombre de poste(s) disponible(s) : 10

Étant une des premières compagnies de massothérapie à se spécialiser dans le massage à domicile dans la région du Grand Montréal, nous continuons à nous démarquer par la qualité des massages et du service que nos massothérapeutes offrent à notre clientèle.

Joignez-vous à Sensia Santé et soyez votre propre patron, mais avec le soutien d’une équipe qualifiée et bienveillante. Des milliers de clients visitent notre site chaque mois pour réserver des massages à domicile et des massages chez nos thérapeutes agréée(s).

Exigences

COMME MASSOTHÉRAPEUTE, CHEZ SENSIA SANTÉ, VOUS POUVEZ :

Faire des massages au domicile de nos clients.

Gagner beaucoup plus d’argent par massage que dans un spa ou que dans une clinique.

Créer et gérer votre propre horaire à partir de l’application sur votre téléphone.

Travailler autant que vous voulez et modifier votre horaire en tout temps.

Vous débarrasser des publicités coûteuses, de la recherche de clients, de la prise de rendez-vous, des paiements ainsi que de

toutes tâches administratives. Nous nous occupons de tout!

Travailler pour vous-même ou pour une autre entreprise tout en travaillant avec nous.

Choisir les régions que vous voulez desservir.

Statut et conditions

Salaire : 60.00$/heure

Nous payons pour la publicité, le système de réservation, le site internet et nous gérons également toutes autres tâches administratives telles que la communication avec les clients, les formulaires de santé, la réception des paiements et tous les autres stress associés à l’exploitation d’une entreprise.

Contact

Richard Sanscartier

(514)804-9444

www.sensiamassage.com

title: Massage Therapy Clinic/Outreach Supervisor
description:
triOS College Business Technology Healthcare Inc. is actively seeking an experienced Registered Massage Therapist, interested in joining the Mississauga Campus team to be a Massage Therapy Clinical Supervisor.

Primary Responsibility

The Clinical Supervisor provides instruction, guidance and mentoring to students as they move from the textbook to the hands-on practical clinic setting.In addition, the Clinic Supervisor oversees the Hospital outreach for our students one day a week.

The Massage Therapy Clinical Supervisor will support the vision, mission, and values of triOS College while contributing to a positive, supportive and student-focused team environment of respect, integrity, dedication and readiness; embracing diversity and fostering inclusion.

Qualifications
  • Registered as a Massage Therapist in Good Standing with the provincial regulatory body (ex. College of Massage Therapists of Ontario (CMTO)).
  • Massage Therapy diploma.
  • Minimum of 2 years of practical work experience as a Registered Massage Therapist.
  • Adult education and teaching experience preferred.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications and use of the Internet.
  • Understanding of Adult Learning Principles is preferred.
  • Valid drivers licence and reliable vehicle
Hours Of Work

This is a part-time on-going position. Hours of work will be 1pm-7pm, Monday, Tuesday and Thursday

Start Date

The scheduled start for this opportunity is immediate.

About TriOS College

triOS College and its subsidiaries are committed to building an intentionally inclusive environment that engages, supports, and empowers diversity and belonging in the workplace and communities served and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.

triOS College Business Technology Healthcare Inc. is a Canadian owned Registered Private Career College in Ontario. At triOS we strive to be the very best at what we do, both in the eyes of our students and coworkers. It is the dedication of our employees that has resulted in triOS as being recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies for 11 consecutive years. Our college was founded on familial values and these have been retained for the last 29 years. We are truly a team in every sense and work collaboratively towards our common goal of preparing job-ready graduates. Our teams are highly motivated and passionate about the work they do and the impact they have on changing the lives of each student that studies at the college. A career at triOS provides you with an opportunity to truly make a difference in the community. We look forward to connecting with you!

Accommodations are available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Massothérapeutes recherché.es
description:
Massothérapeutes recherché.es | Studio Orchidée | Montréal

Date de parution : 9 avril 2019

Entreprise : Studio Orchidée

Ville : Montréal

Nombre de poste(s) disponible(s) : 6

Avec son magnifique mur de brique, arborant fièrement ses couleurs gris pâle, blanc et violet et décoré d’orchidées, le Studio Orchidée est un vrai bijou de la rue Saint-Denis. Établi depuis 7 ans en plein cœur du quartier latin, le studio est composé d’une équipe de 12 massothérapeutes qualifiés offrant une panoplie de massages. On y compte le massage suédois, le massage aux bambous, la massage aux pierres chaudes, le massage californien, le massage sportif ainsi que le massage sur chaise. Il est aussi possible d’y combiner des soins corporels tels que l’exfoliation et l’enveloppement. Offrant des prix compétitifs, une salle en duo y est aussi disponible pour les couples désirant vivre l’expérience en tandem dans un endroit idéal pour lâcher prise!

Exigences

400 heures de cours.

Appartenance à une association professionnelle de massothérapie

Être bilingue.

Être flexible et sociable.

Facturer le studio mensuellement.

Statut et conditions

Travailleur autonome

Horaires flexibles

Payé par massage (selon le type et la durée) chaque semaine

514 224-8855

info.studio.orchidee@gmail.com

title: Clinic Instructor (Massage Therapy)
description:
MaKami College has an exciting opportunity for a Clinic Instructor to join our Horton Road Campus team. As a Clinic Instructor, you are responsible for performing a variety of tasks that assist the Clinic Supervisor in providing clients with high-quality treatment and students with a quality learning experience within a clinical setting.

MaKami College is a provincially accredited Private Vocational College offering a 3,000 Hour diploma program in Advanced Clinical Massage Therapy. Founded in 2001, MaKami is the largest massage therapy school in Alberta. Our vision is to provide a positive learning environment for ALL our students.

We believe that everyone deserves the opportunity to better their lives through the transforming power of education. Therefore, as a team, our goal is to provide our students with demonstrated kindness, understanding, assistance and respect throughout their journey.

Responsibilities Include
  • Directly supervise and instruct students assigned to them during clinic
  • Work in collaboration with the Clinic Manager to monitor student attendance
  • Provide client assessments to ensure the appropriate student is assigned to them based on student skills and knowledge
  • Motivate and encourage students by providing constructive feedback
Education, Experience, And Competencies
  • High school diploma or GED
  • Certificate or Diploma in Massage Therapy from a recognized institution
  • RMT License with 4 years of practical hands-on experience
  • Minimum 2-4 years of clinical experience in an educational setting is considered an asset
  • Have the ability to translate theoretical concepts learned in the classroom to a practical/clinical setting
Please reply to this ad with your cover letter and resume. We thank all applicants that apply, however only those deemed qualified will be contacted to continue in the recruitment process

title: Customs Brokerage Representative I
description:
Before you apply to a job, select your language preference from the options available at the top right of this page.

Explore your next opportunity at a Fortune Global 500 organization. Envision innovative possibilities, experience our rewarding culture, and work with talented teams that help you become better every day. We know what it takes to lead UPS into tomorrow—people with a unique combination of skill + passion. If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.

Job Description

Working from home

Initial training will be held in the office Nelson Road, Vancouver.

Work Schedule: Wednesday to Sunday 11pm to 6am, overnight shift.

Position Summary
  • To process customs clearance (release) AND/OR confirm declarations for repetitive and non-complex shipments guided by the CCBS system and personal skills.Client (Internal/External):Import operations, Support Services, Consulting, Inbound services, Sales, etc, and all customs clients and partnersSpecific output or services:
  • Customs release AND/OR confirm declarations for repetitive and non-complex shipments using client' profile in CCBS system (creates or modifies line code/classification)
  • Handle delivery service AND/OR import permits requests if required AND/OR gather and send proper documentation to the government
Job Key Contributions/Task
  • Data entry (open customers' files, validate information, credit and invoicing)
  • Collect supplementary information or documentation from customers, drivers, custom and other offices, etc, when required
  • Identify customer profiles discrepancies
  • Answer standard questions and requests from customers, drivers, customs and other offices
  • Work as team member with other actors: clients, UPS SCS employees, carriers, inbound agents
Qualifications Required
  • 6 months to 2 years of experience
  • High school degree
  • Bilingualism required - intermediate level (in Quebec Only)
  • Basic knowledge in Customs operations, laws and regulations, and other government departments
  • Basic understanding of HS system
  • Basic computer skills
UPS Supply Chain Solutions offers a competitive total compensation package including:
  • Retirement savings plan
  • UPS Stock Purchase Plan
  • Reimbursement of your tuition fees
  • Employee Assistance Program for you and your family
  • 5 discretionary days per year + Annual vacation
  • Variety of discounts at certain suppliers for our employees, you are eligible as soon as you are hired.
  • Development and career progression opportunities across multiple UPS SCS business units and geographies.
Competitive benefits coverage and even some premiums paid entirely by the employer which includes:
  • Variety of specialists: Osteopath, Naturopath, Masseur, Acupuncturist, Speech therapist, Dietitian, Chiropractor, Physiotherapist, Podiatrist, Psychologist, Social worker, etc.
  • Emergency travel assistance for you and your family
  • Medical services and supplies such as ambulance, hearing aids, orthopedic shoes, etc.
  • Vision care, including eye exam, glasses or contact lenses
  • Life insurance for you and your family
  • Dental services including orthodontics
  • Short and long term disability program
UPS Canada is a diverse and equal opportunity employer. Please advise our HR representatives if workplace accommodation is needed. Thank you for your interest in UPS Canada.

title: Software Development Engineer, LMT Emerging Business & Technology
description:
Description

Amazon Last Mile Technology is the team that enables super-fast delivery for Amazon. We build products and technology that enables the stations and drivers to deliver your packages, food, and restaurant deliveries from their last stop to your home. We need rock start software development engineers to join several new initiatives.

Job Responsibilities Include
  • Design, develop, implement, test, and document embedded or distributed software applications, tools, systems and services.
  • Translate functional requirements into robust, efficient, supportable solutions that work well within the overall system architecture.
  • Participate in the full development cycle, end-to-end, from design, implementation, and testing to documentation, delivery and maintenance.
  • Produce comprehensive, usable software documentation.
  • Evaluate and make decisions around the use of new or existing software products and tools.
  • Mentor junior development engineers.

Basic Qualifications
  • 2+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
  • Programming experience with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
  • 1+ years of experience contributing to the architecture and design
Preferred Qualifications
  • Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field
  • Experience developing iOS and Android application
  • Experience taking a leading role in building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers
  • Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
  • Experience in building high-performance, highly-available and scalable distributed systems.
  • Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe software features, technical designs, and strategy
  • Experience mentoring junior software engineers to improve their skills, and make them more effective, software engineers
  • Experience influencing software engineers best practices within your team
  • Hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, typically ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between
  • Experience with databases
By submitting your application here, you can apply once to be considered for multiple Software Engineer openings across various Amazon teams. If you are successful in passing through the initial application review and assessment, you will be asked to submit your career and personal preferences so that our dedicated recruiters can match you to the right role based on these preferences.

title: Software Development Manager, LMT Emerging Business & Technology
description:
Description

Amazon Last Mile Technology is the team that enables super-fast delivery for Amazon. We build products and technology that enables the stations and drivers to deliver your packages, food, and restaurant deliveries from their last stop to your home. We need software development managers to lead several new initiatives.

The Special Program team takes on new initiatives and new businesses within Amazon's rapidly growing global Last Mile network.

The Successful Candidate Will
  • Be responsible for the end to end ownership of a technology team, including the mobile experience and its direct service dependencies, and setting the technical vision for developing our systems to serve Amazon's needs.
  • Hire and manage great software engineers that are responsible for developing and maintaining software that optimizes our transportation network.
  • Be an advocate for engineering and operational excellence: establish team metrics for measurement of engineering and operational excellence and a consistent, regular process for assessment and improvement.
  • Establish a consistent, project management framework and excellent development processes to deliver high quality software, in rapid iterations, for business partners in multiple geographies.
  • Show strong business and technical judgment that will accelerate time to market of releases, while incrementally moving our services towards the long term vision.
  • Be responsible for mentoring and developing engineers.
  • Represent the technical organization and evangelize the work to senior leadership.
  • Raise the bar on technical excellence, show thought leadership, and communicate well to different audiences.

Basic Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree and/or Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent.
  • A minimum of 3 years of management experience.
  • A minimum of 7 years of relevant development and design experience.
  • Experience in building high-performance, highly-available and scalable distributed systems.
  • Experience with employee development, performance management and delivering results.
  • Problem-solving skills and the abilities to analyze quantitatively, scope technical requirements and effectively prioritize program deliverables.
  • Presentation and written communication skills are essential, as is the ability to build partnerships with senior leaders across a variety of groups throughout Amazon.
Preferred Qualifications
  • Proven experience establishing metrics for measurement of engineering and operational excellence.
  • Experience shipping software for mobile clients.
  • Proven experience in innovative business practices that have been game changing for business evolution.
  • Experience building strategy and executing it with speed and continuous improvement.
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.


Company - Amazon Dev Centre Canada ULC

title: Registered Massage Therapist (RMT) NOC 3236
company: Totally Refreshed Steam and Spa Corp
description:
Registered Massage Therapist (RMT) NOC 3236

Maintain records of treatments given, Massage and knead muscles and soft tissues of the body, Apply finger and hand pressure to specific points of the body, Administer massage techniques through soft tissue manipulation, relaxation techniques, hydrotherapy, trigger point therapy, joint pain and lower grade mobilizations, Suggest home care instructions and provide information about techniques, Assess clients by conducting range of motion and muscle tests and propose treatment plans, Explain procedures, risks and benefits to clients

Education: Other trades certificate or diploma

Experience: Experience an asset

Work Conditions and Physical Capabilities: Combination of sitting, standing, walking, Fast-paced environment, Attention to detail

Credentials (certificates, licenses, memberships, courses, etc.): Certification by a provincial or territorial association for massage therapists

Wage: $27.00 per hour

Permanent, Full time 40.00 hours per week

Benefits: Bonus, Gratuities, Commission

By Email:

Red Deer, AB

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
Elmwood Spa, is Toronto’s leading day spa and the largest day spa in Canada.  We offer careers that are both satisfying and rewarding.

We are always looking to hire Registered Massage Therapists that can work a variety of shifts which include days, evenings, and weekends.  Come join Elmwood Spa/elmspa where we have been pampering and providing well-being for guests for over 35 years. 

10 positions available in permanent, full-time roles. We are located at 18 Elm St. Toronto, ON M5G 1G7. 

We follow strict COVID-19 safety, cleaning, and disinfecting protocols for our Spa, so our employees will feel confident coming into a safe workplace and be able to treat clients effectively while doing what they love. 

Staff are provided with PPE, sanitizing, disinfecting, and cleaning procedures are in place.  Temperature screenings for staff and guests.  Physical distancing guidelines in place.

Work for a company that recognizes your value and provides you with opportunities for upward growth, apply to join our aspirational team!

Full-time, Part-time (weekends included)

Key Responsibilities:

Provides guests/clients with a complete treatment adhering to the Company's standards of consistency and protocol and within the framework of the regulations established by the CMTO;
-Contributes to and strives to achieve our objective of creating and offering a seamless 'magical' experience for every guest by anticipating needs and health conditions with the client's health and safety being paramount;
-Ensures proper documentation of after service notes and that treatment notes are recorded on the health form indicating (at minimum) techniques used, length of massage, and whether a receipt was issued;
-Ensures massage rooms and common areas are kept neat, clean and clutter free at all times and all equipment is in safe and working order;
-Actively promotes retail sales through educating, recommending and up-selling products to our guests; working towards a 5% retail to service ratio.
-Participates fully and enthusiastically in the implementation of all new initiatives;
-Helps to educate and provide support to all staff members within the company whenever there is an opportunity;
-Participates in finding viable solutions to any issues or concerns that may present a challenge to the department or business;
-Provides coverage for other RMT's as and when required;
-Attends and contributes at regularly scheduled Department Meetings;
-Assists with other duties within the Spa as reasonably assigned from time to time.

COVID-19 precaution(s):

  • Personal protective equipment provided.
  • Temperature screenings for staff and guests
  • Physical distancing guidelines in place
  • Sanitizing, disinfecting, or cleaning procedures in place

BUILD A CAREER WITH BENEFITS

  • Graduate Assistance Program (GAP)
  • $1500 Signing Bonus (SB)
  • Competitive Hourly Rate + Premiums
  • Learn new modalities to advance your career and get paid while learning.
  • Health benefits (medical, dental & vision)
  • Tuition reimbursement for FT employees

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • valid registration with CMTO or eligible to obtain
  • Proof of valid liability/malpractice insurance
  • Reliable
  • Effective communicator (English written and spoken)
  • Passionate, nurturing, and caring disposition

title: Registered Massage Therapy (RMT) Clinic Supervisor
description:
About Us

 

For more than 50 years, CDI College has been one of the leading career training institutions in Canada, thanks to its commitment to quality education and the success of its students. Our rich history includes alumni of thousands of successful graduates who embark on careers rich in opportunity. We are happy to say that we are looking for an experienced Registered Massage Therapist Clinic Supervisor to join our Instructor team! 

The purpose of the Registered Massage Therapist Clinic Supervisor is to lead and contribute to the academic success of students and to the success of the College in achieving its statement of purpose. Under general direction, the Registered Massage Therapist Clinic Supervisor is responsible for providing stage supervision and facilitating student learning according to the prescribed curriculum.

Job Responsibilities

Specifically, the Registered Massage Therapist Clinic Supervisor will be responsible for

  • Monitoring and reviewing students during clinical placements
  • Evaluating student performance fairly and consistently
  • Supporting the administrative functions of the campus to enhance the student experience
  • Acting in a manner that upholds the College standards

Qualifications

 

To be successful in the Registered Massage Therapist Clinic Supervisor position, individuals must be committed to developing, maintaining and demonstrating the following:

Education and Experience:

  • Degree or diploma from a recognized University or College in a relevant discipline.
  • Three or more years’ experience in a related field, or the equivalent combination of education and teaching experience.
  • Current membership/licence with relevant regulatory body preferred.
  • Satisfy specific position qualifications as prescribed in program design and program approval for the instruction of the courses. 

Skills and Abilities:

  • Relevant industry skills and knowledge relating to the area of instruction.
  • Interest in pedagogical and multi-modal education approaches an asset.
  • Advanced oral and written communication skills
  • Ability to motivate and inspire students.
  • High standards of behaviour, a professional attitude and commitment to quality service.
  • Ability to work cooperatively with other Dental Assistant Instructors, students and staff.
  • Ability to consider and respond appropriately to the needs, feelings and capabilities of students, to provide feedback and treat students equitably.

title: Massage Therapist
description:
Description

Midtown est à la recherche d'un massothérapeute pour s'assurer que les membres et les invités vivent des expériences de spa luxueuses.

Le poste

Faisant partie intégrante de l'équipe du spa, nos massothérapeutes sont des professionnels compétents et attentionnés, intéressés par le bien-être et la satisfaction personnelle de nos membres et invités. Ils connaissent les dernières tendances et techniques de massage et ont un impact positif sur le succès de notre club en démontrant les avantages du massage à nos clients.

Responsabilités du massothérapeute :

  • Répondre aux besoins de manière professionnelle, positive et opportune
  • Organiser le poste de travail, la salle de traitement, l'éclairage, le son et se renseigner auprès du niveau de confort des clients tout au long du service
  • Maintenir la propreté des zones du spa tout au long du quart de travail, éliminer les déchets et les conduites sales et sécuriser les fournitures à la fin du quart de travail
  • Collaborer avec d'autres associés et les aider à promouvoir les services du spa et à atteindre les objectifs du service
  • Effectuer des traitements pour les clients et maintenir la propreté et les normes d'assainissement de la salle de traitement pour le confort et la sécurité des clients
  • Promouvoir les services de spa/salon et vendre des produits au détail

Exigences du massothérapeute :

  • Au moins un an d'expérience et une licence d'état en cours
  • Certifié par une école de massothérapie crédible
  • Expérience antérieure en service à la clientèle préférée

Midtown is looking for a Massage Therapist to ensure that members and guests have luxurious spa experiences.

The Position

As an integral part of the spa team, our Massage Therapists are knowledgeable and caring professionals, interested in the well-being and personal satisfaction of our members and guests. They are skilled in the latest massage trends and techniques, and, have a positive impact on the success of our club by demonstrating the benefits of massage to our clients.

Massage Therapist responsibilities:

  • Address needs in a professional, positive, and timely manner
  • Arrange work station, treatment room, lighting, sound and inquire with guest comfort level throughout service
  • Maintain cleanliness of spa areas throughout shift, dispose of trash and dirty lines, and secure supplies at end of shift
  • Partner with and assisting other associates to promote spa services and achieve department goals
  • Perform treatments for guests and maintain treatment room cleanliness and sanitation standard for guest comfort and safety
  • Promote Spa/salon services and sell retail products

Massage Therapist requirements:

  • At least one year of experience and a current state license
  • Certified by a credible massage therapy school
  • Previous customer service experience preferred

This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.

MIDTOWN is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

title: Registered Massage Therapist RMT
description:
Considering a change and just checking out what other practice locations are out there? Or perhaps trying to decide where to start up your career? We invite you to take 2 minutes to read this post as some food for thought.


Yes, Hand and Stone Burlington is a big location, we have 7 treatment rooms offering Registered Massage Therapy, and that takes a certain amount of staff. For some, this is not a fit, and we understand, but please allow us to share a different perspective.
Hand and Stone Burlington is easily one of, if not the number one, go to place for Registered Massage Therapy in Burlington and surrounding areas. We've been in the community for nearly 10 years and have a great reputation (Google us to be sure). Clients know they have access to a variety of providers with various techniques and strengths, so having different staff to find their match with is a huge asset and brings them in to us. Additionally, clients know they can call and get in to see an RMT within 24 hours when needed, be it for an acute or nagging concern, to relieve accumulating stress, or spoil themselves, so that means you will see variety in your day.
Yes, we're a busy location, BUT, we're a busy location. You can let go of that stress of having to market yourself, or worry whether you will make the income you require, or be bored day after day, week after week without being able to do what you trained hard to become. That would be kind of nice, wouldn't it?
So, why not give us a call and find out a bit more. Not every location is run by the same owner, and this one is not like the others.  There's a reason we're the number ONE Spa, year after year.
 
We have all kinds of other stuff to tell you about how you can make up to $1400 per week, before gratuities, working 25 appointments, or how our computer system lets you check your schedule or make notes from your phone, or how if you're a new grad you can get your CMTO and licensing fees paid for up front, or how we'll pay you to learn Himalayan salt stone and hot stone treatments, decompression therapy/cupping, prenatal massage and lots more, as well as tons of other great stuff, but you'll need to reach out first. A phone conversation with us just might be the change you're looking for. 
If you're not an RMT yet, and are nervous about completing your licensing tests (MCQ and OSCE), we can help you with that too.  We are partnered with a great company that offers a prep course to help you succeed, and we pay for this course for you - a $475 value.  Just reach out to us to learn how.  We want to support you and see you succeed.

What it's like to work at Hand & Stone Burlington:
-Start your day with a friendly smile from out front desk team and a quick covid screen (done for all staff everyday to ensure your safety),
-review your clients on our computers, tablets, or your phone,
-take your client from our lobby to your treatment room,
-perform your unique massage treatment,
-sign the insurance receipt that has been prepared for you in a folder at the front desk,
-remake the table (with help from our cleaning team when possible) using linens stocked in the room for you,
-leave the used linens in laundry bins where they are laundered, folded and restocked in the treatment room for you,
-make a treatment note (again from your phone, tablet, or computer), and
-collect your next client (or head home, if it's the end of your day). 

That's it.  Your clients are booked, welcomed, prescreened, rebooked, and invoiced for you by our front desk team that care deeply about customer service, without any additional charges or deductions from your pay.
If you're a new grad, there's also a 7 step program to support your growth and practice as a new RMT for 1 full YEAR by one of our in-house coach/mentor/trainers.  They answer any questions you have as you navigate challenges and new situations that come with starting out as an RMT.  This is the program that also pays for up to $1000.00 of your registration fees.

Here's a bunch of other stuff that we're supposed to say and that is important...

Just so you know, we are on top of everything; we follow strict COVID-19 safety, cleaning and disinfecting protocols for our Spa, so everyone will feel safe in our environment. PPE and all cleaning and disinfecting materials are provided for you and clients must sign a pre-screen clearance and waiver prior to treatment.  It is a priority to support our team so that their days canrun smoothly. 

We believe in creating an inclusive and uplifting environment for everyone at Hand & Stone with trust and respect as our guide.We look forward to speaking with you and sharing how we work diligently to create a safe and healthy environment for everyone.  
QUALIFICATIONS:• Current Massage Therapy registration with the CMTO
• Reliable, confident and effective communication• Passionate, nurturing and caring disposition


#HSBurlington

I understand that each independent franchisee is solely responsible for all decisions relating to employees including and without limitation hiring and termination, benefits, compensation, day to day activities, and terms or conditions of employment. Any questions about my application or the hiring process must be directed to the locally owned and operated Hand & Stone franchisee.

description:

  • 5636 Glen Erin Drive, Mississauga ON.

  • 190 Robert Speck Parkway, Mississauga ON.

We are proud to offer the following:
  • RMTs have the opportunity to grow their clientele base and enjoy a successful career at Kaizen.

  • full or part-time schedules are offered to RMTs that vary from one day to up to 7 days per week, your choice.

title: Registered Massage Therapist (FT)
description:
Nexus Massage & Rehab is a multi-disciplinary clinic located at busy Yonge and Eglinton. Our clinic offers a collaboration of massage therapy, chiropractic, physiotherapy, acupuncture and osteopathy to help patients achieve the their Optimal Self!
 
Nexus was founded by a Chiropractor and a RMT who understands the hard work that you do. We are a dynamic, fun, loving team who are looking for a driven, and motivated RMT to join our thriving team! 

  • What our patients say about us: https://goo.gl/maps/7EKy5TrVUNt
  • Check out our Team: https://nexushealthclinic.com/team
  • Learn about our story: https://nexushealthclinic.com/about-us

Why work at Nexus:
  • Health Allowances so you can get treated and take care of your own body (*subject to approval)
  • On-going training and one-on-one mentorship with the clinic owners who focus on YOUR GROWTH as a healthcare professional and entrepreneur. You will learn different skills to improve on treatments and how to build a strong caseload.
  • Monthly Clinic Rounds where practitioners learn and teach diagnostic and treatment techniques.
  • Opportunity to be a part of an external Practice Acceleration Program with top Canadian practitioners to grow your caseload and generate better patient outcomes.
  • Treatment Exchanges! We love to learn from each other's techniques and as a bonus, you will have an opportunity to exchange treatments with each other.
  •  Financial Rewards Plan to increase your earning potential. 
  •  Team Building Events where we have FUN together! We have quarterly team building eventsto encourage practitioners to de-stress and let loose!
 
ADDITIONAL PERKS:
  • A busy location at Yonge and Eglinton, with lots of restaurants
  • Mentorship in caseload building
  • Flexible schedules and hours
  • Laundry and receptionist service
  • Electronic medical records (paperless)
  • State of the art equipment and supplies provided

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
SNAPSHOT:

Quality Care Sports Injury & Rehab is a top-rated clinic (4.9/5 Google rating) serving Oakville patients for over 31 years. Our services include Physiotherapy, Pelvic Physiotherapy, Chiropractic, Athletic Therapy, and Active Living and our focus is on one-on-one premium care with private-pay patients. We are currently looking for a hardworking Registered Massage Therapist to join the Quality Care team of highly-skilled practitioners. We are looking for a strong candidate to help grow our practice with us by being the go-to RMT at our clinic.

WHAT QUALITY CARE SPORTS INJURY IS LOOKING FOR FOR IN A HIRE:

  • Hungry to build their book and growth further via social media, community outreach to local businesses, Dental office or Orthotic business relations, or calling RMT patients to sell RMT services;
  • Leadership abilities - driver of business, not a passive practitioner;
  • Friendly and outgoing personality;
  • Great customer service skills;
  • Great organizational skills;
  • Multitasking and time-management skills;
  • Ability to work independently and be proactive with ideas and implementation.

WHY YOU MIGHT BE INTERESTED IN WORKING AT QUALITY CARE SPORTS INJURY & REHAB:

  • Thousands of patients from our 31 years of top notch service;
  • High performing team with almost >97% book back rates;
  • Private-pay patients who are loyal to their practitioners;
  • Opportunity to own equity based on future performance;
  • Immediate profit share for new client acquisition and product sales;
  • Marketing support to go alongside your own outreach and full time front desk to help you manage patient load;
  • Jane booking system and sophisticated reporting and billing to keep things organized;
  • Our team is very friendly and responsive, so you get to enjoy autonomy, while also having the benefit of a supportive team behind you;
  • Top-rated clinic with satisfied patients and positive team morale;
  • Option for hourly or % pay models.

CLINICAL:

  • Assessing, reassessing, and treating patients - own/lead their care plans with the collaboration of the team to ensure the best patient outcomes
  • Emailing past patients to check-in, ask about injuries, sending exercise/stretch video links to be helpful, while letting people know you are here
  • Blogs/posts - optional not required - great candidates will have a propensity to write helpful communications


Wellness Impact Partners is a health and wellness recruiting agency that works on behalf of its clients in finding top candidates across Canada. For more information visit


Requirements

REQUIREMENTS:

  • Registered RMT in good standing with the College of RMTs of Ontario;
  • Proof of double vaccination;
  • Willing to contact patients directly to confirm rebooking;
  • Personal protective equipment provided and required to be worn including sanitizing, disinfecting, cleaning procedures, and social distancing in place;
  • Flawless written and verbal communication in English.




REQUIREMENTS: Registered RMT in good standing with the College of RMTs of Ontario; Proof of double vaccination; Willing to contact patients directly to confirm rebooking; Personal protective equipment provided and required to be worn including sanitizing, disinfecting, cleaning procedures, and social distancing in place; Flawless written and verbal communication in English.

title: Registered Massage Therapist (FT)
description:
Join our team that is revolutionizing the rehab industry in Ottawa. We are like-minded individuals who bring their passion to inspire and empower the community to take care of their bodies and change their lifestyles. We are more than a therapy and wellness company; we are a people company. Together we have created a culture that provides everyone with the opportunity to initiate change and grow both on the professional and individual level. We have developed this through joint collaborations including mentorships and internal educational seminars.
 
As Vitality Massage Therapist, we believe you must have the passion to constantly grow and expand your knowledge and skill set. We currently have 3 clinics with plans of growth and expansion, with more opportunities to come. We are an award-winning team with currently the highest rated clinics on Google reviews in Ottawa with over 600+, 5-star reviews and have won the Consumers Choice and Top Choice Awards for best physiotherapy and wellness clinic.
 
Your Commitment:
  • Understand the Vitality philosophy and deliver an exceptional client experience
  • Follow the clinics' processes and operations to provide the Vitality experience
  • Effectively understand the client’s medical history, symptoms, and long-term goals to focus on longevity
  • Develop and communicate clearly personalized treatment plans for each client based on their ultimate goals and their “why”
  • Accurately document as per college guideline client’s condition and progress
  • Build relationships with other staff and thrive within the culture
  • Build strong rapport with clients from a variety of backgrounds through strong communication and providing the Vitality experience
  • Understand how to quickly implement new technology and software changes in the ever-changing industry to enhance client engagement
  • Participate in community development initiatives to drive branding awareness and new assessments.
  • Participate in on-going clinical education (internal and external)
  • In coordination with the clinic director, review compliance and performance to determine the level of support and training required to help you grow.

Your Profile:
  • Licensed and in good standing with CMTO
  • Appropriate liability insurance
  • Flexibility to work mornings, evenings and/or weekends
  • Strong communication skills and engagement
  • Wants to explore and grow with the team with clear career planning

Why Vitality?

We live our values and are in the pursuit of excellence in everything we do. We believe in a fair compensation philosophy.
 
  • Signing Bonus ($)
  • Fee-split ($)
  • Career Pathways (Planning)
  • 5 Assessments per week to build your caseload ($)  Full Case Load Available
  • Regular Support in building and maintaining your caseload ($)
  • Paid subscription (approx. $200) to clinician education site Embodia ($)
  • Vacation pay ($)
  • Paid time off for self-care, family/friends, travel ($)
  • Paid onboarding and training ($)
  • Company sponsored team dinners and Quarterly appreciation events ($)
  • Other perks (see below)
  • No admin work! We manage all reception, appointment, invoicing, and billing for you
  • Laundry all done for you
  • Remote access for online charting
 
Career progression OPTIONS:
  • Focus on your clinical work and be a super-star therapist for your patients
  • Diversify your clinical work and get involved in the business side of things
 
We believe in MENTORSHIP! 
 
Whether you are a seasoned clinician or a new grad, we help you plan your certification and (new) programs to sharpen and add new skills to your clinical tool-kit. As clinicians our learning never ends.
 
How does it work? 
  • You will meet monthly with a Lead RMT
  • Practice new and advance techniques to build and sharpen your skills
  • Course and certification planning and roadmap
  • Get help to build a full caseload and maintain it
  • How to create a treatment plan and keep patients committed to it so they graduate and get their outcomes/why
 
Contact me if you have the same CORE VALUES:
  • Empowering together 
  • Re-inventing experiences    
  • Authenticity
  • Integrity
  • Celebrating the wellbeing and success of every person
  • The Pursuit of excellence
 
Well, you’ve kept reading. That’s great! Here are some more perks our RMTs have requested and received:
  • Extra hours available ($)
  • Personal branding for referrals
  • Collaborations with other brands
  • State of the art equipment
  • Remote access to documentation
  • Company retreats
 
Take Action! If you admire who we are and believe in our vision, and are ready to roll up your sleeves and grow, we’d love to meet you.





    About Vitality Physiotherapy and Wellness Centre:

    The rehabilitation industry has been around for years, however, it has not progressed and evolved to keep up with patients’ needs. Vitality Physiotherapy and Wellness Centre has patient needs, quality service, and overall client experience as its core values. This is the change the industry needed.When looking for a new clinic, patients may face a daunting experience, filled with unknowns. Not knowing what to expect or what the path to recovery might look like can take a toll on patients. This can sometimes limit patients from finding the right health care professional and delay their recovery. In order to help patients in their path to recovery, our founder understood this and wanted to transform the industry.Here’s the story of how Vitality Physiotherapy and Wellness Centre came to be the revolutionary industry leader it is today: In 2016, Vitality Physiotherapy and Wellness Centre founder and registered physiotherapist Andrew Istefanos learned that the physiotherapy industry operated using outdated procedures. From his experience working in various clinics in the Greater Toronto Area, he learned that these outdated procedures were the industry norm. Andrew quickly realized that his patient-centered approach helped his patients achieve true wellness.. He believed collaborative care including physiotherapy and massage therapy was meant to be personal, one-on-one, and integrated. Developing a system with individualized treatments influenced by advanced clinical research including manual therapy and movement based exercises, Andrew quickly started to define the future of rehab. This approach created an environment that encouraged dialogue with patients and noted their needs and wants. As a result of this dialogue, it became clear that patients wanted an elevated experience, available in luxurious spaces with private rooms and an open-concept gym with state of the art equipment. With these founding principles, Vitality Physiotherapy and Wellness Centre came to life.

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
About Us


We are a group of Award-Winning Boutique Wellness Clinics located in Canada and the Caribbean. Our focus is Preventative Health, and we work with top medical practitioners to offer services that are aimed at healthy living. We bridge the gap between traditional and alternative medicine to help prevent, heal, and manage the disease while boosting vitality. Our clinics deliver a multi-faceted approach to optimizing your health and slowing down aging, including a variety of health and beauty products and services. We were one of the first clinics in Canada to truly embrace and execute the concept of integrative care through cross-collaboration and building synergies amongst various practitioners. We are now in our 9th year of operations and look forward to many more.

We currently own and operate the following clinics. For more information about us and our clinics please visit â€“ www.thewellnesscorp.ca

  • BeWell @ Clarkson Health Clinic, South Mississauga 
  • BeWell @ Hamilton Health Clinic, Corktown â€“ Hamilton
  • BeWell Health Clinic, Toronto
  • EatWell Health Centre, Toronto
  • Simcoe Place Health Clinic, Toronto
  • Vitality Medical Clinic, Punta Cana

BeWell Health Clinic is a multidisciplinary health clinic led by Psychiatrists, the team is comprised of MDs, Psychologists, Psychotherapists, Social Workers, Naturopathic Doctors, Acupuncturists, Mindfulness & Breath Coaches, RMTs, and many more all housed in one state of the art facility. Our model of care is truly integrative where all practitioners work closely with each other to reach the best patient outcomes. 

The Role

The clinic offers an excellent work environment. Our client base consists mainly of professionals from surrounding companies, most of whom are looking for deep tissue massage from a knowledgeable therapist. We pride ourselves on our patient-centered care and are looking for someone who is friendly and able to quickly build rapport. We are committed to quality patient-centered care, leading clinical practices, and collaborative teamwork. We are supportive, respectful, caring, and accountable toward our patients and staff.

Main job duties would be as follows:

  • Provide therapeutic massages to patients by appointments
  • Review patientâ€™s medical history and note any medical conditions
  • Determine the type of massage best suited for the patient.
  • Provide appropriate treatment to the patients based on their needs, goals, and preferences.
  • Communicate warmly, effectively, positively, and professionally with patients.
  • Utilizing e-charting software to document treatment sessions and recommendations.
  • Collaborating with the inter-professional team at the clinic
  • Managing caseload in a fast-paced environment
  • Lead clients through individualized care plans - accurately assessing, communicating, and providing hands-on treatment to facilitate goal attainment for the client.
  • Engage in continuous learning and skills development.
  • Advise clients of stretching, strengthening or relaxation methods
  • work closely with other practitioners and are motivated to grow their practice.

Qualification

  • Must be registered and in good standing with the College of Massage Therapists of Ontario (CMTO)
  • Excellent clinical knowledge
  • Create a custom treatment plan for each patient -inclusive of maintenance programs when necessary
  • Friendly with exceptional interpersonal skills, build rapport quickly
  • Educate patients on other services provided by the Clinic
  • Stays up to date on new techniques and relevant offerings
  • Reliable professional with a strong work ethic

Why Us?

  • Competitive split OR base salary offered while you grow your practice.
  • All supplies provided by the Clinic (linens, oil/lotions/gel)
  • Flexible working schedule
  • Large existing practice
  • Great Administrative support
  • Warm and personable team-based atmosphere
  • A fast-growing company with lots of growth potential
  • Lumino Health Marketing provided
  • Complimentary services at the clinic ($2000 value)
  • Skincare and wellness products at cost (Hello SkinCeuticals!!)

title: Registered Massage Therapist
description:
MYo Lab Health & Wellness Inc. is a small business in Calgary, AB. We are bold, social, and customer-centric, and our goal is to provide elite multidisciplinary healthcare to the community.

Our work environment includes:
  • Safe work environment
  • Growth opportunities
  • On-the-job training

Are you looking for an upgrade to your Massage career? Tired of the typical go with the flow clinic setting and desire more clear direction, mentorship and training to take your practice to the next level? Do you strive to be one of the greatest RMTs in Calgary and beyond?

If so, we at MYo Lab Health & Wellness want to meet you!

At MYo Lab you will be surrounded by like-minded professionals with the common goal of providing the best possible service to our members. You will be supported in weekly 1:1 meetings, role-play opportunities, access to elite coaching from around the world, research reviews and more. At MYo we operate as a team, with a member-first core value to best ensure every member gets the same excellent experience; as such, MYo operates under the idea that if you do something once, a system is needed to ensure it is done consistently to the best possible outcome by everyone on the team. If this is something you find restrictive, MYo may not be the best fit for you.

Base salary & incentive plan provided, as well as a health spending account or education fund.

Benefits
  • Extended health care
  • Dental care
  • Vision care
  • Paid time off
  • Casual dress
  • Flexible schedule
  • Wellness program
  • Profit sharing
  • Company events
  • On-site gym
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Store discount

Schedule Options (Please be sure to include in your application which options you desire):
OPTION 1: Sundays @10-6pm; Mondays= OFF; Tuesdays @1-9pm; Wednesdays @12:30-2pm Team Meeting + 2-9pm; Thursdays @1-9pm

= 31 Hours of Massage + 1.5 Team Meeting = 32.5 Total Hours over 4 days/week

OPTION 2: Sundays= OFF; Mondays @1-9pm; Tuesdays @1-9pm; Wednesdays @12:30-2pm Team Meeting + 2-9 pm; Thursdays @1-9pm
= 31 Hours of Massage + 1.5 Team Meeting = 32.5 Total Hours over 4 days/week

OPTION 3: Sundays @10-6pm; Mondays @5:30-9pm; Tuesdays: 1-9pm; Wednesday @10-7pm (12:30-2pm Team Meeting); Thursdays @1-9pm
= 35 Hours of Massage + 1.5 Team Meeting = 36.5 Total Hours over 5 days/week

OPTION 4: Sundays @10-6pm; Mondays @1-9pm; Tuesdays @10 - 6pm; Wednesdays @12:30-9pm (12:30-2pm Team Meeting); Thursdays @5:30-9pm
*
= 34.5 Hours of Massage + 1.5 Team Meeting = 36 Total Hours over 5 days/week*
If this is exactly what you've been looking for please submit your resume and a personalized CV to tell us more about yourself, your aspirations, and why you responded to this ad. Also, please provide information regarding your desired start date and schedule (please review the hours listed on our website/Google to determine).

If you are still reading this you are already more driven and determined than the average and we are excited to hear from you!

title: Mokara Spa Toronto- Registered Massage Therapist Full-time)
description:
Overview / vue gÃƒ ©nÃƒ ©rale:

King Edward Hotel

 

With its rich history, timeless elegance, and modern hospitality, the Omni King Edward Hotel has been a favourite of both locals and visitors for over 110 years. Located in the heart of downtown Toronto, this landmark hotel is just steps away from a wealth of diverse restaurants, tourist hotspots, and shopping centres.   It's no wonder the Omni King Edward is the perfect destination for business and leisure travellers alike.  


The Omni King Edward Hotel's associates enjoy a dynamic and exciting work environment, comprehensive training and mentoring, along with the pride that comes from working for a company with a reputation for exceptional service. We embody a culture of respect, gratitude and empowerment day in and day out. If you are a friendly, motivated person, with a passion to serve others, the Omni King Edward Hotel may be your perfect match

Job Description / description de l'emploi:

Join Canada's first Mokara Spa at the Omni King Edward Hotel!   $400.00 - Signing Bonus  

 

Perform massage treatment plan based on guestâ€™s medical assessment, needs and concerns.    Provide efficient service and create memorable experiences by exceeding guest expectations.  

Qualifications / qualifications:
  • Must be registered and in good standing with College of Massage Therapists of Ontario (CMTO)
  • Practice various massage therapy modalities, including but not limited to Swedish Massage, Deep Tissue Massage, and Prenatal Massage
  • Strong communication skills  
  • Must speak English fluently
  • Must be guest-service oriented, team player, positive and friendly

 

Whatâ€™s in it for me?

  • Both part time and full time position available  
  • Total Compensation: $55 - $70 per hour  
  • Flexible hours: Wednesday to Sunday
  • Tuition reimbursement for continuing education  
  • Growth opportunities
  • Benefit package  
  • Uniforms provided
  • Spacious treatment rooms equipped with hydraulic tables, warmer, hot towel cabbies, sound system and dimmable lights  
  • Centrally located in the financial district, one block each of King subway station  

 

Responsibilities / responsabilitÃƒ ©s:
  • Assess and propose the most effective treatment plan for guests within the time booked  
  • Administer the appropriate pressue and massage techniques for the respective condition while monitoring guest's comfort level  
  • Ensure that all guests receive an exceptional and positive spa experience  
  • Following treatment, provide expert advice, including but not limited to self care instructions that may help the guest's wellbeing
  • Document guest's condition and progress following each treatment
  • Maintain cleanliness of treatment room, sanitize and disinfect surface areas, remove used linens and setup rooms after each treatment

If you answered yes to these questions,

Our Commitment:

title: Massage Therapist
description:
Founded in 2002, Vida Spas offer uniquely luxurious, personalized traditional and healing spa experiences including treatments based on the ancient Indian science of Ayurveda.  With four locations currently serving clients in Vancouver and Whistler, we are always looking for talent to join our Vida family. Vida Spa believes in sustainable growth by cultivating wellness from the inside out. www.vidaspas.com
 
Our Values:
  • We are mindful.  We are present in everything we do.  Every employee and guest feel listened to and taken care of.
  • We are open.  Everyone is an individual with different needs.  We respect and honor individuals, their beliefs, and their practices.
  • We live by example demonstrating a healthy approach to life.
  • We perform our best every day.  Excellence in what we do is the enabler for Vida to grow its business and to touch and affect more people.
  • We are committed to learning.  Ongoing learning is the key to positive change and the cultivation of overall health.
 
We are currently recruiting for Vida Spa at the Fairmont Chateau Whistler.
 
Job Description: Massage Therapist 
 
Profile:
An individual committed to surpassing our valued guest’s expectations.  As a Therapist, the individual must perform massages with attention to quality, detail, and service performance.  This individual must also embrace & promote Vida Spa's philosophy of a positive and healthy work environment.
 
Skills Required:
  • Strong technical skills, listening skills, and communication skills.  Please note - A practical exam will also be conducted
  • A positive and optimistic attitude with a passion for the Wellness industry- a true team player
 
Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Perform your role to the best of your ability while demonstrating five-star customer service to all guests.
  • Perform your role with a positive attitude at all times.
  • Adhere strictly to the Vida Spa Hygiene Protocols.
  • Adhere strictly to Vida Spa Massage Manual.
  • Between your massage treatments, assist with stocking and removal of linen

There are many benefits to working with Vida, which include:
  • Discounts on Spa retail, and services
  • Competitive Wage
  • Extended Medical – (Vida covers 50% of the monthly premiums) (only available to those who work 32hrs+)
  • Reimbursement for ski passes (For those who work 32hr + as well)
  • Oscars - the FCW Employee Café allows Vida staff to purchase meal cards at $5 per meal ticket. 
  • A supportive team-working environment
 
If you feel you possess Vida’s philosophy, we ask that you send in your resume to the below email address.
 
Apply To:  Bonnie@vidaspas.com
Please note only qualified candidates will be contacted

title: Registered Massage Therapist (RMT)
description:
Registered Massage Therapist (RMT)

Our award-winning multidisciplinary clinic is looking for a Registered Massage Therapist to join our growing team.

Are you a team player who is great at building relationships and passionate about helping others? If so, we want you to join our dynamic group of healthcare professionals.  Our therapists are Burnaby's leading back, knee, and neck pain specialists, and dedicated to helping our patients get back to living a life they love.  As our Registered Massage Therapist, you will have the opportunity to grow your skills and learn from top physicians in a multidisciplinary clinic environment.

Responsibilities

  • Provide 30, 45, and 60-minute deep tissue, relaxation, and pre/post-natal massages using techniques such as myofascial release, trigger point release, and joint mobilization
  • Execute clinical assessments and implement treatment plans for clients
  • Monitor client progress and provide ongoing evaluation
  • Communicate important information and educate clients on treatment strategies
  • Keep accurate, up-to-date clinical records
  • Work with other therapists and external stakeholders as needed
  • Participate in continuous learning to further enhance skills
  • Ability to work through situations with professionalism and confidentiality

Skills and Experience

  • Registered member and in good standing with the College of Massage Therapists of BC (CMTBC)
  • Massage Therapy Certification from College of Massage Therapy diploma program
  • Experience and/or interest in pre-and post-natal massage
  • Relevant experience is an asset
  • New graduates are welcome to apply

Hours

Hours are flexible and can be discussed in-person

About Royal Treatment Therapeutics

Located in South Burnaby, Royal Treatment Therapeutics is a multidisciplinary wellness centre passionate about outstanding patient care.  We offer a variety of services including massage therapy, physiotherapy, chiropractic, acupuncture, Traditional Chinese Medicine, and more.  All our practitioners are registered in their respective fields and dedicated to providing exceptional care in a warm and welcoming environment.  Whether a patient is seeking pain relief, stress reduction, or relaxation, we make it our mission to provide the "royal treatment" at our award-winning clinic.

Why work with Us

  • Comprehensive and competitive compensation package
  • Flexible work schedules so you can set your own hours
  • Access to our portfolio of clients
  • A multidisciplinary team who refers patients internally to other therapists
  • Full-time reception and billing services
  • Online booking with Jane App allows you to see your schedule from anywhere
  • Benefit from our in-house marketing team with digital and print ads promoting you and your services
  • All supplies provided including on-site linen and laundry services
